btCSrtFgFDofulwEImrmjw.text: Went for the first time during lunch and my experience was fantastic.  Fast, Fresh, and very friendly.  Cant wait to go back...

JdOPOGWoVux4QzqxYJXY8A.text: The fiancee and I love Greek food and wanted to make a stop to try out a new Greek place! After walking in we were greeted by friendly people. We ordered two gyros. One was a chicken meal with feta fries (yum) and a beef/lamb gyro with an added steak skewer. After waiting a few minutes our food came out. Instantly we were both surprised by how much tzatiki sauce was on both gyros. Seriously there was a ton! After scraping some of the sauce off we were ready to eat. I went first with my lamb/beef gyro and it was quite tasty. The biggest problem with both gyros was the tzatiki sauce wasn't implanted into every bite! The tzatiki sauce was misplaced and hopefully they can fix that. The chicken we both tried was very dry. The steak skewer was cooked to perfection. Seriously good, but it could have used some salt. Overall I'll be back but ask for lighter tzatiki sauce and hopefully they can put it on the pita bread as well as some on top.

1nfnk-9CDYtCcuCDP-a9cw.text: Great place. Great food, ambience is pretty amazing! I have gone to both locations now and I appreciate their consistency throughout the brand.

cxV6wr7QJ0zHMEs6Fv_9lQ.text: Excellent quick serve Greek food. I ate at their other location in Henderson a couple of times, and I'm super happy to see a Westside location. Their food is excellent, always fresh, and I really like the atmosphere. Best gyro in town. Highly recommended!

8W_is3H6HsCxlLK7dqmstA.text: bomb bomb bomb!!! portions are huge and the food is delicious!! i'd eat here everyday!

a7KsqECEqJjB6EOGf9N3Kw.text: This was really great place and food was amazing. The place was very really clean. We ordered several items as take out and all of the dishes were good. The surprize was  the Yia Yia's Pastitsio, it was so flavorful- super yum! I hope to come back again soon.

8PI3OCYZ5GfELEH70ZpJlw.text: I am giving this place a 1 star because of the customer service . As soon as we walked in the door at 8:50 we were told .. ohh we close at 9 by the way . Not a hello, welcome nothing . So basically she told us we couldn't stay and eat that we had to take it to go . It was so uncomfortable that the couple next to us was sitting down eating and they got up and left and the lady cleaning the table said oh you can stay and they still got up and left . About 5 min later a group of 8 people walked in and they told them the same thing I can take your order but you can't stay . I will never be back because of the horrible service .

9d1xZgPsyrumNa70sUzh2Q.text: OMG I love this place. So glad they opened closer to me!! I got the lamb/beef gyro and it is so full of meat you can barely hold it with two hands. For dessert we had baklava ice cream. I thought I died and went to heaven, such a great combo of flavors.

yTw3N39kv7gIyAT2pATvcw.text: The Great Greek is really GREAT. One of the best gyros I have ever had. And it is right by my house. I've been there 3 times and the gyro is soo good I haven't ordered anything else! Definitely check this place out.

cHAKffDiBN3GWuWLj7oDIg.text: First time trying it here didn't know what to expect, I  ordered the Greek salad with shrimp and chicken it was greasy and delicious... nice helpful staff as well.. definitely coming back soon to eat more authentic Greek cuisine

y7gJ1oqlxsAanZc41JlFJw.text: Amazing. From the moment you walk in the decor is fresh and slightly urban with an incredibly inviting.  The staff is super polite and helpful.  The food is fantastic. Two can split many of the entrees.   I can't wait to return!

QgpdBkdG6N_SDlBhHZjuYw.text: i am a huge fan of mediterranean food.... this place is amazing...great food, super nice staff and great pricing. sorry crazy pita....you lost me to the great greek mediterranean  grill!

AsHv27wWMiV7t5h7jHM5KQ.text: The Greek food here is so good and smooth. The steak for the pitas melts in your mouth . It is so great. The lobby is very welcoming and inviting. Our cashier brought us our food and continued to make sure our food was delicious and we were comfortable. Which we were

0aTj37ZdvrkDNe2P4OgMtg.text: My favorite Greek quick food option and now it's on south west side of town at Decatur and Blue Diamond.  Can't go wrong ever with chicken kabobs or the gyro plate. Delicious

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro with Salad instead of Fries

HxG0Gvif_GB0bxFP0Vp9oA.text: Good food, quick service, nice size plate of food for the price. I'd recommend it to anyone in the area for a quick healthy bite.

6oMyo1SmLOAyB4a_2Tv7OA.text: We get takeout here at least once a week!! Chicken souvlaki plate with rice is where it's at!! The chicken is charred to perfection with a hint of lemon. The tzatziki sauce is on point and it comes with the most delicious side salad. If I'm feeling extra fancy, I sometimes add on an avgolemano soup, it's so simple but so satisfying. Their dolmas and feta fries are yummy too. Everything I've tried here is great, and customer service is always friendly. Place is always clean. Keep it up Great Greek

fylKddnIsIpBtVIF0KSiaw.text: Simple fresh ingredients! I love good Greek food and The Great Greek is just that - great! Came here on a Monday afternoon for lunch and the place was pretty busy. I ordered the Greek salad as a wrap. The dish was simple yet the flavor was amazing and the lettuce seemed very fresh. We also enjoyed the feta fries - you can never go wrong with cheese and fries!   My friend got the combination plate with lamb and steak and said the meat was excellent. I would return to the Great Greek and recommend it for a quick healthy lunch!

tdESxSkPlBKpk2crD-9hqg.text: I order the Greek salad with chicken/shrimp skewers. It was so fresh and so satisfying! Will definitely be back! Place was nice and clean. The staff was friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aly_wfEpDAqS6B2GOiOJRQ.text: Great food! Staff excellent! My wife eats vegan and gluten-free whereas I want the rest so it is a good place for us

tKGLZkgtnyk73Bua6VCYkw.text: So thrilled a Greek place opened nearby. The food is fresh, no frills, and delicious.   This is my second time in and it's still very good. I love consistency! The service was also faster this time (came on a Sunday holiday weekend evening).   Also checked out the bathroom this visit and it's clean.   Love this place!

izNf05mpaX7GmWPPiTH4Eg.text: Love the food here.   Always so fresh and tastes amazing. Staff is friendly and always smiling.  They're also very patient (since I never know what I want) and always willing to answer questions with out giving off a bad vibe!

tKwFvs99KN8Pz2epED7Cng.text: Staff very friendly and nice. We wanted to change it up from the traditional burger place and I'm glad we did. I ended up getting the rice bowl which definitely hit the spot after traveling all day and eating nothing.

D8wllNubaFK-hTsv_DRqjA.text: The feta fries were the highlight of my family's first time here. I've been to numerous greek/Mediterranean spots and since this place is fairly new and near where we live, we decided to finally give it a try. We ordered the traditional gyro and shrimp and steak kabob plate...it was alright. I tried asking if they have the special garlic sauce, my heart shattered when the gentleman mentioned, "I know Stephano's has it but we don't have that here." I haven't been there (yet!) but I've been to places like Manna and Meraki that carries the super "oh so yummy" garlic sauce that makes the food that much more delicious. For two plates, it was close to $30 which is quite on the pricey side, in my opinion. The place was clean and the traffic was steady on a Sunday afternoon. The workers didn't seem as upbeat as other Greek/Mediterranean places that I've been to. My son enjoyed the pita bread and I guess that's why I gave this place three stars...it was fresh, warm...the way it should be.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TWshZlDdFyqhzEmv_ckuTw.text: I was really wanting some Greek chicken. I remember seeing this place awhile back and decided to give it a try. 5 stars. Great food, relaxing and clean atmosphere. Quick service. I will eat here again, probably a couple times a week.

8lv2EdM9U2HUSBwAB1M6GQ.text: First time here for lunch on 5/27/18. Great food, everything tasted very fresh. Even the soda was good! I will say that the feta fries are great! I couldn't eat them fast enough! Next time I plan on having them with the lamb/beef gyro meat. Very clean inside & a bright room. I will definitely be back! Thank you for a tasty lunch!

czIR4yzEgK8jNRwvVZVquw.text: When I found this place off blue diamond I immediately fell in love! So good I returned 2 nights in a row! And am yet to be disappointed. I got the hummus and pita bread for appetizer and you can tell right away the pita I quality either home-made or locally sourced based on the freshness. Went with the great Greek gyro combo (beef) which comes with a side Greek salad and a drink. The auto was huge portion and the salad was dressed properly (not too much dressing) I also tried the mezze platter for an appetizer that gave you a good variety of Greek finger food and everything was amazing! The second night I got the shrimp plate which was also a hefty portion for the price with amazing flavor start to finish!

7ypah_wWxRbv-9sKtf-mBg.text: Awesome staff, fantastic quality. This has become my favorite Greek restaurant of all. I would highly recommend this one!!

jzShSSlBunzVDN5s9l-qeA.text: I love this place. My favorite place to eat at the moment. It's close to my house and the wait isn't long. Everything I've eaten here was great and flavorful. I'd recommend the salads or the shrimp plate, but whatever you get I'm pretty sure you'd be satisfied.

0ZjlD0T-zEXYqh3bTxXa3w.text: 3.5 STARS   Friendly service. Love the rustic industrial ambience. We ordered the great Greek gyro, feta fries, Athenian burger & hummus.  Greek lamb gyro A+ says my husband  Feta fries C Athenian burger B Hummus A+  I gave the fries a low grade because it tastes like the fries were old & fried again.  The Athenian burger was good but not the best.  The hummus with pita bread was excellent. My husband loved the gyro.

GgHRIiOYsPoYtvTVNPSrhA.text: Love the food here. Always served fresh and so amazing. The tzatziki is incredible.  Ask for jalepeno in it.

3lxhF6udLAASISCFmJhkFQ.text: I have eaten here a great number of times and each time the food is fresh, delicious and hearty. The customer service is always quick and friendly so I'm not sure what other are saying as I have always gotten correct order fast wether eating in or taking out.

mMHL9Z0sAJRbriP4lPchMw.text: I wanted to get some Greek food for lunch and found this place. I got a chicken gyro and salad. It was really good. The pita was so soft and I'm glad I didn't ask for extra feta because finally a place that puts on the proper amount!  I will definitely go here again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6DyWOSqu1lHtjNM4AB5bVQ.text: The food is fresh. The service fair.  Upon ordering and paying i am prompted to, would i like to leave a 15-18-20 % tip.  For what. Standing in line to order my food to go or at best eat there. Get my own water/drink.  I dont think so. The online ordering was a terrible experience. I could not order what i wanted. The site kept showing the wrong quantity. The lid to my salad dressing was not put on tight and leaked all over the bag.

3dob_bMgh_gQzwb2E3PBQg.text: This is our favorite Friday night date night dinner spot. Service is awesome!  Staff very friendly and helpful. Food is so out of this world GREAT. I switch up between the lamb skewers and the gyro. Stacy has the beef skewers as a rule. The salads are awesome. Just a little heavy on the onion. You must try them if you like real Greek food.

c4FjeP8O9HCM-joQ1IlrgA.text: First time here, my husband went yesterday . We both got the Lamb great Greek gyros... they are huge and delicious. We also got fries and the butter cookies which are also really good ! We will be back

FN5Ibalst_m96lTtNrGHfw.text: Discovered this gem on a drive by. Authentic Greek food made with love. My daughter had the falafel gyro and I had the lamb/beef gyro. Both were wonderfully delicious. I also had a small salad and she had fries. The salad was fresh and delicious with romaine, feta, kalamata olives, and most importantly, the tomatoes were fresh and crispy. The fries were crispy and flavorful too. I highly recommend this business. You won't be disappointed!

3o7JDVZL9lCqyjfA5FRnVA.text: Tonight was my first time at the Great Greek!  All I can say is WOW!!!  I was immediately impressed with how clean and sleek the restaurant looked.  You know when a restaurant goes through the effort of putting fresh flowers on the table, that they care about freshness.  Now onto the food, absolutely unbelievable!  We had hummus as an appetizer, then both my husband and I order traditional gyro's where he had rice pilaf and I had feta fries.   This food was spot on and the pita was so fresh you could tell it was right out of the oven.   And the lamb was incredible! The staff was quick and friendly,  I loved everything about it.   I will be back!  My new go to for Greek food!   Love love love!

MLDLoWXHG2r97joQzESoFw.text: I have been a customer of The Great Greek located in Henderson for quite some time. So, when I saw the sign go up that they were building a Great Greek near me I was pretty excited to say the least. My to go meal is the greek salad with gyro meat. It's always so fresh and crisp! I have tried several greek salads around town and the Great Greek remains my favorite! I recently tried their chicken skewer plate and it was delicious as well! I have noticed it's quite busy at this location as well, but worth the wait!

WVt5RshsvwSqUvmU95RhjQ.text: Fast, casual, clean, and super fresh greek food. Love this place. Salads with a meat add-on and the lemon soup are my favorite but everything's great. Friendly and efficient staff. Good location

CHmjgyEn68_t42FZvdplLA.text: Falafel pita was delicious!  Great service even though place was packed.  Love their order online option - easy to use.  Will return and recommend for sure.

08sns0RFLKRtxyez9nL2AQ.text: Delicious Greek food! Tried the gyro and side of rice and loved both however seating is limited. Maybe 12 tables plus a bar like counter. Went here on a weekday evening and took the last table. They do carryout as well!

3rqaxf8Ofme7_kPW0Rai0g.text: Love the selection of their foods... their meat is not dry (compare to the other stores) ,all the sides are goid as well... love the interior design as well...

VEYL_wwRsAcdX3WE7Oce1Q.text: I'm so glad The Great Greek moved to this new location. I was initially worried that the food might be different or not as good here but I'm so glad they've kept the integrity of the food as the original location. The salmon Great Greek rice bowl along with the hummus and pita is everything your taste buds needs and more.

TQFwNfSkISMhOoPPp1utGA.text: We drive by the place a lot and we finally made it in for the first time. There was a line when we walked in and the dining room was almost full which was a good sign. It also gave us a chance to look at the menu as well as see entrees being brought out to the tables. We placed our order and about 10 minutes later one of the girls came to our table telling us that it was going to be a 30 minute wait for rice and asked if we wanted to wait or get a different side but we went ahead and decided to wait since we wanted to have rice with the meat. It really did take 30 minutes for the rice to cook. Then we noticed them starting to serve plates with rice and other tables that had been there way after us we're getting their food first. My husband had to go tot the counter and talk to someone and let them know we were there way before these other customers and the girl told him that they just start putting rice on all the plates but not in the order that they were placed. We finally got our food and fortunately it was very good. It was disappointing that they would run out of rice on a busy Saturday during lunch causing us to have to have a long wait for our food. After this experience we don't know if we will come back or even recommend the place to our family and friends.

ytXvhuCcMYoDPTCZvXfIfg.text: The freakin best.  Those feta fries... lord have mercy!!! Must try.  The gyro meat is very good as well, flavorful and tender.  I'd prefer crispier but that's minor.  The gyro plate is very filling,  loved the salad and rice and pita with the meat.

hWCN0g8QUCCgWhJS19Hvsw.text: I have been wanting to try this out for a few months. - The food was Excellent, tasty and pretty authentic. Half of my family is Greek so I compare and contrast to Aunts and Grandmothers recipes handed down for generations. I will be going back very soon to try the rest of the menu. I had the Greek Pastitsio and Avgolemeno soup and they gave me a greek salad on the side (may have actually been too much food, even for me). i give the Pastitsio an 8 out of 10 just because NOBODY makes it like my grandmother but this is pretty darn good. - the Avgolemeno soup however I will give a 9.5 - i will say this was one of the best tasting lemon soups with chicken i have ever had. I am extremely impressed. I was so into the food i completely forget to make some food porn images. I will take more when I go back.

enOxbULprgncJs_X3OKbxQ.text: As far as I am concerned this place is tied with Milos at the Cosmopolitan as far as taste, authenticity and freshness. I am always willing to make the trek to Henderson so my pleasure that there is one in the SW can't be measured.  If you love Greek food - do not sleep on The Great Greek.

SZK9RT3HS0tPWmDuK4oAEQ.text: Glad  they finally have a location near me . The food is incredibly fresh and great tasting . The BEST gyros in Las Vegas hands down . Prices are very fare when compared . The owner and staff really do care. A must try .

eYXxLfYQ-MWAyh8AefVDkg.text: Love love love this place.  Great portions and very consistent!!  So nice having a place of quality near Mtns Edge!  My husband usually is not a fan of Greek food but he loves this place!

Zx0Owwp-F4tVhHbccxg9Kw.text: This place is deliciously fresh and tasty. Love the look of the inside. So cute. The food was so fresh tasting. My husband and I shared a gyro meat plate, I also had the chicken lemon soup. It was all so delicious. I usually don't like tiziki sauce (that I've tried at another Greek place down the street) but theirs was so yummy and fresh. I literally could put it on everything. I highly recommend this place and am beyond happy it's right down the street!! :)

Y4PgEx_1FHsYfHxlwaBXlA.text: Great food! So happy it's close to my house. Great pita bread and hummus they will give u more if your sitting down to eat but make sure if your ordering to go you order extra pita bread they do not give enough.  Tomatoes in salad are little big I always cut them smaller. They once Ran out of rice ...... thought that was really weird but substituted fries . Great chicken tenderness and flavor

EmVEOZ-X5HLbKZPfmQzsrg.text: This is my favorite Greek  place in Vegas ...100% for food and really good  service. I visited 2 stores Henderson and then new one the same food ...The new one is bigger and more tables and outdoor sits .

NVdW6KIB-Wj2c-btzuhN4A.text: Excellent l, fresh, authentic Greek food. You can tell the staff values their customers. They are on the ball, courteous, and were extremely knowledgeable and took great care due to my celiacs. Bought a home in Vegas and will definitely be a regular here!

5sIRf9tuCJ4zxYXgV8eYHQ.text: This place is really great, The food is amazing and the portions are generous. always look forward to get my Greek salad and my gyro wrap here. Absolutely delicious... Also if you order your food to go , they are really fast on delivery.

iLizfx264SVPUU62ceLUKg.text: New owners and it sux!  No more pastitio.  Lemon soup tastes different.  The gyro meat was freezer dried taste.  Bad meat tasting.  So, so, so sad.  Used to love this place and go there 2-3 times a week.  Looking for new favorite Greek place.  So disappointed

ghr9OsKGh1M2IJWHIiHE8Q.text: Good food. We've always gotten either delivery or takeout. One of our regular rotation places. The feta fries here are not my favorite, but that's ok. The actual plain french fries are really good. Everything else we've tried on the menu has been good and consistent.   Another minor complaint i have is how they glob the yogurt/feta mixture on the end of their gyros. I always have to push it off then dip my gyro in it while I'm eating. It's annoying.

_r92RmL8itKuNrRzIzyD_g.text: Came here for lunch. Staff was super friendly and helpful with the menu. The decor was very modern and fresh looking. The restaurant was set up fast food style where you order your food at the register and it is brought to you. Don't let that fool you the food isn't fast food style but gourmet Greek food. The gyro and steak souvalki was very good full of flavor. I love that they have a kids meals here not only with the traditional chicken nuggets but actually Greek food made smaller for kids. My children loved the kids chicken souvlaki and they offer it with soda or a juice box.    You have to have to order the feta frys. I've never had anything like it feta and and another type of cheese with more Greek seasoning on it so good I could not stop eating it!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side salad very good and presented so pretty!
Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Greek Gyro
Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak souvlaki with Feta Fries. So good!!!

EX6P3WYDCNgOgFkfHrEjaQ.text: Gyro is sliced too thick for my taste. Falafel undercook and raw inside. It's my fault for ordering falafel at Greek place. After all it's not a Greek specialty.  Had to throw away.  Rice and fries are delicious  Also chicken gyro is very good.

zwATdk1Wxr6xAoooZrVqSA.text: This was my first time going here. We ordered a Great Greek Gyro (chicken), feta fries, a four dip combo and spanakopita. The gyro was really good. I was kind of sad when it was gone. Spanakopita was also good, nice and flaky. The feta fries... AMAZING! My kid almost stole them all. We got the four dip combo because although I have had tzatziki and hummus before, I had never had the other two dips (that I can neither spell nor pronounce) and wanted to try them. Although I wasn't fond of the two new (to me) dips, the tzatziki and hummus were fantastic. Probably the best I have ever had. I will most definitely be going back for the gyro, feta fries and hummus.  Store was very clean and the service was great.

LI7-W8jJi39fRpOYzudTAQ.text: Good food and good service. My husband and I came here for lunch and it was pretty good. We came around 11:30am and it was just before the lunch rush. The ambience is very modern and casual. I ordered the Grill Chicken Kabob and my husband got the gyro plate. Both selections were very yummy and their fries and yogurt sauce is on point! The service was great, as well. We got our food less than 10mins of ordering it and the staff checked up on us frequently. We will definitely come back in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Great Greek Gyro
Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Chicken Souvlaki
Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side salad

SaxtxMCc4CK0AYgCUs9Erw.text: Stopped in and ordered lunch to go. The place is clean, awesome decor, and the staff was friendly! I ordered the chicken souvlaki plate. Comes with two chicken skewers, rice (or fries), pita and a side salad. It's a lot of food so I feel the price was worth it. The ONLY thing i was bummed and didn't realize till I got all the way back to work, is it didn't come with any hummus for the pita . Noted for next time though!  My order was ready QUICK. Which surprised me because the place was fairly busy. I was pleasantly surprised.  The food, oh my gosh, the food was SO good. The chicken had great flavor and wasn't all dried out like most kabob places. The portions were fairly big, I could have ate half and saved half for later, but it was so good a finished my whole plate    I'll definitely be going back! And remembering to get a side of hummus next time

208D3vOjRkLJymZ7x_gI0A.text: Would've been 5 stars but my last order wasn't on point. Have been ordering lunch from the place a few days in a row this week. I enjoyed the falafel salad but each time the falafel was different. In flavor and texture. Not sure if different cooks do different things but it wasn't consistent. First two time were great, last time not so much. Then I ordered the hummus and had this great homemade hummus and then the last time I'm not sure what they put in those small containers. Didn't taste the same. The food can be very good and worth the money.   I can say that it was prepared fast and my food seemed fresh. My friends food wasn't as fresh. The last time the salmon had a smell to it. I'm vegan but when I did eat seafood I know that when it smells it's not fresh or going bad. So that wasn't cool.   Again the food was initially good which is why I kept ordering from them but it's becoming to be a gamble which isn't cool. I'm not the type to keep calling a place to get my order correct so I just move on to the next place.   Oh and this was delivery. Maybe my experience would've been better if I dined in. This place isn't off my list yet, just wanted to give an honest review.  I may have to dine in to give them one more try.

Vhl_rcznZ-jO0sOK2_xXMA.text: I had the Greek salad with gyro meat last week for lunch. It was very fresh and a generous portion. My only complaint is that the meat was soggy. It didn't have any of the nice thinner edges that stay slightly crisp. It was still very tasty.   Service was okay. We got our order to go and it took a while for the woman at the counter to acknowledge us when we were at the counter.   Their tzatziki is amazing in both flavor and texture.

mLpfpzg_iu7eNi7MN9lw8w.text: My go to for Gyros! The fetta is fresh and moist! We stop there Everytime we head to Pahrump because it's right on Blue Diamond!

HNK0BS4FK73Jv2vR2nh1aQ.text: I didn't know what to expect walking into the Great Greek. I was hungry and had heard good things, so I decided to check it out. It is a fast food Greek restaurant. The interior was clean and orderly, even though they were at the tail end of a busy lunch rush.  You order at the counter and they bring the food to your table. The staff are helpful and will help you figure out the menu.  I tried the beef/lamb Great Greek Gyro, with a salad on the side. They also offer the Gyro with chicken.The Gyro was a little heavy on sauce, but the flavors were good. The tomatoes and onions were fresh and popping with flavor.  The salad was crisp and refreshing. Watch out, the kalamata olives still have pits in them.  The staff collected our dishes as soon as we finished, they were definitely on top of their game. Impressive for such a new restaurant.  This was a quick and easy meal that tasted pretty darn good. I'll be back!

JNhJuQp2Nzbe7G5_pe5miQ.text: Very good food. Tender, flavorful chicken. Salads are amazing. Tzatziki sauce (cucumber yougurt) was delicious. Also, the employees were very nice and accommodating. Wish I would have taken pictures but the food looked so good I just dug right in. I can see why the business was non-stop my entire visit.

-tYf37erM3F30q2leAPCoQ.text: Ordered the great geek gyro with lamb & beef, and a side of pita bread with hummus. It was absolutely delicious and was delivered in a timely manner. I will definitely be ordering more ofte

GxWZqJj04z6I_5WwFZAcjw.text: Holy Baklava! First time eating here....ordered Chicken Souvlaki Platter and Shrimp Souvlaki Platter. Meals came with a nice sized Greek Salad, two generous portions of Chicken and Shrimp for each plate, tzaziki sauce, and we tried the rice pilaf on one plate and gooey melted Feta Fries (.50 cent upcharge.....totally worth it). Also, comes with soft pita bread. Everything delicious, well seasoned and chicken very moist!  Ordered a side of Hummus as the platter does not come with it....that would be my only suggestion in that a small side of Hummus to dip the pita in, would perfectly complete the platter!  Just an excellent meal....We will be back soon and will share our delicious dining experience with friends and family.... Mahalo!

JyHDlGuN0OVFiHsuAApUoA.text: The Great Greek is everything you would expect from a Greek restaurant: gyros, salads, baklava, you know the drill. The interior is sleek and modern, and the staff were friendly.   The Great Greek has a perfect location if you live in that part of town, since you literally turn right off of Blue Diamond to access the restaurant, perfect if you're craving greek on the way home from work. Give them a call, order up, and your food will be ready by the time you arrive.   The food is good, but nothing that will particularly blow you away. The tzatziki was noticeably creamier than other tzatziki sauces I've had in the past. It was an interesting change of textures, but was slightly ruined by the fact that they LAYERED that s*** on my gyro. Unless you're into that, be mindful when ordered and maybe ask for it on the side to control your own destiny.   Overall, it's nice to have another Greek restaurant, but Stephanos is still the undisputed Greek God when it comes to Greek food. The Great Greek is...good, but I'll have to visit a couple more times and have something magnificent before I would consider it 'Great'.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6sQCy6qEiyJJ5UV4NeGbcw.text: The food was awesome!! My co-workers and I tried a variety of menu items and the food is seasoned nicely and the portions were huge! Food was extremely fresh. The place is kept nice and clean. The service was not bad at all for it being lunch hours the wait was not even 5 mins. Great job we will be back.

TSEnJHAXVwYQoN4wICgUwA.text: Honestly was stocked to have this near the house. Heard it opened and been wanting to try it. Asked the Hubby if he wanted to have dinner there this evening only to be disappointed.   We ordered the traditional Gyro (beef/lamb). It was a HOT mess! Everything was falling apart. The sauce was overpowering and I couldn't taste the flavor of the meat. The meat was cut carelessly. Some where thick, some were thin and some were super thick. The feta fries were very sad. Served "cold" where the feta was just blooped on top. Was difficult to eat as well.   Ordered a chicken fingers kids meal and it was overpriced. Came with three very small pieces of chicken, fries and salad.   Place was packed, clean and LOUD!  Would we come back? Nope.

ndaTMrxnUYuapJ_ojIGC-A.text: Alex has great customer service! Alex greeted us with a smile on his face and told us if we need anything to let him now! He is a True hard worker!

THvVGBPgHKkFM9_zOse-Tg.text: This is a great little neighborhood Greek spot. We went in mid-week around 8 p.m. and the place was clean and the customer service was fantastic. We were recommended to try the feta fries (amazing) and we ordered a gyro plate and a grilled shrimp skewer plate. Both came with a really fresh Greek salad and rice pilaf, which was also quite good.  Portion sizes were huge (we had enough for dinner and lunch the next day). My husband really liked the gyro, he only wished that they had put it on the flatgrill for a couple of minutes to crispen it up just a bit. My shrimp was flavorful and not overcooked and the plate came with 2 large skewers of shrimp. We will definately be back!

1uwVNDG8HuyPOS841dOtSg.text: My favorite new place in the Southwest. I go at least once a week. The gyro meat is delicious and the portions are very generous. The eggplant dip is my favorite appetizer. I can't say enough about how much I love this place.

EY9FJ2Jnh-Knpj6v3jwHMA.text: Fresh delicious Mediterranean food. Try the classic Greek salad with the add-on chicken or salmon skewer.   Well designed eating area. Outdoor seating also available.   We really needed a good quick easy restaurant choice on this side of town. Right in Blue Diamond.   It truly is great!

MfAX0NkRudp5wh7f7_5Wrg.text: Happy to see this business thrive in the Las Vegas community.  Serving great food!  It's quick service, great quality and friendly service.  Restaurants like Me Gusta Tacos and Great Greek coming into the southwest part of the valley are a great thing!  Keep doing your thing great Greek!

bdH4JuT9PZruNNdVxB4-Jg.text: I was THRILLED...that The Great Greek opened a restaurant in the Southwest area of the valley. I have previously eaten at their Henderson location - quite frequently and loved it. For a brand new restaurant, you would have no idea, because the team that is in place there knows what they are doing. They offer fast, friendly and accurate customer service. There is no different in the food from location to location - at least that I am able to tell anyway.   From this restaurant, I've had the Grilled Garlic Shrimp and the Grilled Steak Souvlaki with Feta Fries - Both were excellent and will satisfy any craving that you're having, especially the Feta Fries. In terms of desert the Baklava is the best that I've ever had. A few weeks ago, I took a friend from Oklahoma here while he was in town and he described the Baklava as "being the best he's ever had outside of Greece."   There is good seating indoor and outdoor. With long lines it can get a little tight, but that's just part of living in a city like Las Vegas. The restaurant does to-go orders, but you have to place the order in the store. Once this location is able to handle online orders I will be more apt to grab dinner. This reason, and because they ran out of rice at 8:30pm on a Tuesday night (it was close to closing time) is the reason for a four star rating. Once the online thing is up and running, five stars!

pOYe1eqvFv2Bf1tItXGHjg.text: Excellent food and service here!  Checked out the restaurant shortly after it opened, and it's a great addition to the southwest part of town!  I come here fairly often, and am always satisfied.  During my last visit, I witnessed a grown man have a meltdown over a pepperoncini, and the staff responded professionally, and calmly despite the comments made towards them.  They work hard to provide a welcoming environment, and they are great at ensuring customers are satisfied.  Cleanliness is always spot on!  Even when busy, they make their way around to clean up the seating area, and pick up your plates when you're done.  I've come here every week since opening, and haven't seen the place a mess yet. The food is also always consistent, and is made perfectly every time.  If something doesn't come out to perfection, they quickly remake it without incident.    I will continue to frequent this location, and highly recommend this place to others!

h_6DW-4qi5e4A10BWDkq9g.text: Place is awesome. Great food. The ice T is good. Close by. Nice employees,fair pricing never a long wait.

5gbLaDlZ87i1N6iYfrfODQ.text: This was the best service and delicious food!  We were camping at the nearby rv park and wanted a meal before we hit he road!  This should definitely be a five star choice!  Fresh food and service with a smile!  Thank you so much for a terrific meal!  Very generous portions!!

byGH83at2Zen08UKH0mpwQ.text: Today's food is horrible. They were okay before; now I have to give them one star; food stinks, rice is dry. the food not fresh. Fz2MJvqzoEljaz71StYGyg.text: This place is great. The food is always fresh.  Sorry I ate everything and forgot to take pictures.  The staff is friendly.  And they are efficient and fast. ufFbUjBCNPWboMmzzGwcAQ.text: Delicious food, quick service. What more could you want from a fast-food Greek restaurant? 8J2rjwnqrM5h4KfQLOSXzQ.text: This place was so awesome we had a lamb chops special it was the best night ever have had, and I'll be Greek food all over the United States!

JwyLULgq-5q2pq1zGZtCEQ.text: My favorite Greek restaurant in Vegas. Great service and great food! Never had a bad meal here.

idLB6_7gY3Xj1IN-wJbbTQ.text: Four of us loved our food.  Lamb kabobs, steak kabobs, Greek salad with grilled salmon was all delish!  The tzatziki sauce and pita was great.  They are about to open a third location in the Las Vegas area.  Price is very good for portion sizes. Food came out of kitchen quickly.  Restaurant very clean.  Bathroom clean. Could use a vestibule at entry door to keep cool or hot air out.   Beautiful pictures of Greece on the walls would be a great way to add to the ambience.  Add this one to your must do list and get away from the Las Vegas crowds and  noise!  Food was great and we would go again!

7PytLAOy3_IQDmpX2lMbPg.text: A pleasant local surprise. First time dining here. The staff is friendly and efficient. Clean and spacious restaurant. My Gyro was stuffed with thick tasty beef. I liked the fact that the eat-in counter had tall comfortable chairs. Will return.

biQc3Rd07FamlSKiuiTsTA.text: Love The Great Greek and beyond excited to now have it in the SW on Blue Diamond and Decatur. The food is always so very fresh so you can't go wrong with anything  here! The decor is also very nice.

8nFfkzIlryILNycSwb4WIw.text: Picked up lunch to go today and everything was perfect. We had the Traditional gyro combo with fries, the gyro was HUGE and flavorful, the fries were seasoned and crispy. We also had the beef skewers with rice pilaf and salad, again generous portions, well cooked and flavorful. The staff was very friendly, the food was ready in the 10 minutes they quoted on the phone, and the order was accurate.  I will be back soon, and often! I'm so happy to have some delicious Greek food near home.

5Nr4nRyxLnoSABaTG0rKoA.text: The Great Greek has the best gyro that I have eaten here in Vegas!  It was so flavorful and they do not skimp on the meat!  The pita bread was perfect, as well!  The pita was soft but sturdy enough to hold the ingredients well.    My husband and I shared an order of feta fries.  The feta fries were amazing!  The fries were crisp and flavorful. The feta cheese topping was so flavorful and melted to perfection.  It was a generous amount and was perfect to share with our gyros.    This restaurant is a must for great gyros!  We will definitely go back soon!  The reason I only gave four stars is because of the dining area.  The dining area was not that special.  If the dining area had nicer tables and chairs and a more pleasant atmosphere/ambiance with actual waiter service and wine and beer it would actually be pretty perfect.    I will say the employees were nice, especially the man that took the order at the counter.  He was very helpful!

I9FGf5QKfc7RouCLFbtOmg.text: I am so excited that a The Great Greek location has opened closer to my house in the SW. The food is delicious and the customer service is excellent. One of my favorite places to eat and I cannot wait to become a regular again!

HhcCEtxLLeIMA17tPkLNAw.text: Sooooooo impressed with every single aspect of this beautiful restaurant. First of all, the service here is so genuine, really refreshing decor and the food is amazing. Yes, AMAZING!   The owners of the restaurant should take pride in the wonderful people working behind the counter. They are so helpful and really know all the dishes that they serve. They go out of their way every single time when it comes to our order to make sure we're satisfied. I just can't say enough great things about the staff here.   The food is fresh and very flavorful, I don't know where they find such beautiful tomatoes for their salad but these are the real deal! These are not your grocery store variety tomatoes, they really do taste homegrown.  Their hummus and their pita bread are probably some of the best pita and hummus that I have ever had. As a family, we have ordered many dishes here and a lot of crazy to go orders, and they are perfect every single time.  I highly suggest this place for a date, a fun dinner with family, and especially if you're looking to impress coworkers or a boss! My family eats here just about every single week because we love it so much.  Love, love, love!

uiaETHXFtZclxPPQeph3hQ.text: Great first experience here! Large portions, fast, delicious food, clean and bright atmosphere. The bows, gyro plate and chicken dish were all great. The baklava was just ok but we'll definitely return. Great addition to Blue Diamond.

6ImolKkIFz7pHmbzBclZdg.text: We ran across this place while making a quick stop over in Vegas. This place will not disappoint even the pickiest eaters. The chicken was moist and the salad was delicious. Service was fast and a great price for your portion size.

1X2ZzLkX2zIip--TZn_kfQ.text: Yesterday around 6:30 we ordered dinner for 4 people through Eat24. While ordering we weren't to clear about some of the items on the menu. No big deal. We just decided to call to get clarification. We called three separate times: 1st time: we just wanted to know about their combos. When the call was answered we were asked if we cold be placed in hold. The wait time wasn't long at all but the woman at the other end of the phone was EXTREMELY rude and hung up on us before we could ask all of our questions. We only had two....   2nd time: same thing.  3rd time: our order arrived between 45-60 min after we pressed, which was expected but our order was incorrect. When we called back the same woman from the first two called answered and continued to be very rude. And again hung up.We just wanted to let them know that what we presented was not prepared how we ordered it.    All though our order was incorrect, it was very good. There's no question that they have good food. The reason for two stars is because of the customer service we received. I'm not usually one to leave reviews. But I think they may need to look at how they treat customers who call their establishment. That experience alone is enough to not make me want to order there again regardless of how good the food is. Customer service is key!!

ZSBSPsfQbNUBLF90Y-Z07Q.text: Wifey and I were craving some gyros. Our typical spot is all the way in Henderson so we decided to check this place out. The place is clean with nice decorations and overall inviting atmosphere. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. I gave it a 3 stars based only on their gyros. To me it lack flavor and that certain "umph", it does not beat our favorite spot but it's not the worst either. Fries were nothing special but the feta fries was something worth getting. Wifey also enjoyed their Baklava dessert. Would come back but definitely nothing I would be dying to go for.

LHDWIAs64PyAUaRu3SgERA.text: We order pickup and food is packed nicely to prevent any spillage from happening. Food quality is delicious. We always order the dolmades! The desert options are yummy and if you enjoy Greek food, you can't go wrong!

U25Fl-UV19zPavixOnyfFw.text: This is one of the better Greek places in town. The food is reasonable and fresh. I have the gyro plate and wifey gets the Greek salad. We come here frequently and haven't been disappointed yet.

8yHkODvRS1cHLxoHrvQHuw.text: This is in a little strip center off Blue Diamond near Arville. Cute spot and they even have an outdoor patio and it's clean.  We went in for lunch with friends and that was a perfect time or even take out. It's nothing fancy but very cute decor. We had a couple of (small) Greek salads. One with and one with chicken. Then the boys had a grilled chicken Souvlaki (which is skewered chicken) and it comes with a choice of a few sides. We did the side salad (which was a nice portion) and the FETA fries.  I highly recommend the feta fries! And eat them hot. Oh MY!!! And truthfully the hubby and I could have split the chicken souvlaki (which by the way the chicken was not over cooked or dry but could have used a little more seasoning) with all the sides it was plenty for two. Everything was super fresh and the salads were not over dressed. I will definitely be back and most likely grab some for dinner on the way home some night. Loved the freshness of all the food.

bchNtwtiDLLBYSAUzEdDdg.text: Amazing customer service!  Looking for a place to eat and chitchat with a dear friend, we happened upon the Great Greek.  She had her one-year-old with her so we wanted to find some place appropriate, accommodating, and with indoor seating.  It was quite packed when we got there, with no seats left inside (only tall counter area left, which is kind of difficult to manage with a one-year-old).  Before we walked out, one of the servers / food runners saw us and told us to hold on because a couple tables were getting ready to leave soon.  He told us that he'd clean it up right away and get us a highchair, too.  I thought it was amazing that he even spotted us in the midst of all the food running and the fact that it was quite busy.  It's not a waiter-type of restaurant; it's the order-at-the-counter-and-get-a-table-tent-number-type of restaurant, but still.    The food was just as good.  The hummus was absolutely delicious.  Not the overly fancy kind where they try to throw everything but the kitchen sink in it.  Just straight up good hummus.    The gyro was rather large, which was great because I was super hungry.  I enjoyed it.  The vegetables were fresh and the meat was tender and flavorful.    The baklava was good, but different.  Kind of tasted like cereal, granola, and really tasty honey.  Overall, I really liked this place.  It's a cute, casual spot that's great for catching up with friends or grabbing a bite with family.  Nice, friendly, and helpful staff.  Would recommend and would definitely go back.

vw-1Pj5o-u8ICC3ym5WboA.text: I told the person at front that the chicken was too dry and she give me the worst answer ever ""that's the way we do it "" she thought I was asking for my money back but just a suggestion for other customers...she needs to know we like a customers want good food not the money back very sad  customer service

EGnvBYZaRcxp2P1RFvLIMQ.text: Reliably excellent.  Best falafel ever - crunchy outside and still moist inside.  Greek salad can't be beat.  Gyro warm spicy flavorful.  Spot on food quality just like Henderson location.  Bright friendly environment and attentive staff.  Go out of your way to come here.

cW3DYBJX7hyH2k7TdftPRg.text: Highly Addictive!!  This place is hands down one of the best fast casual places I've been to in Vegas.  I am on the Keto diet so I get the Athenian Burger with no bun and it's delicious.    Their food is FRESH and they're quick on call-in orders.   Call from the strip, it'll be ready by the time you get there.  My GF probably goes here 5+ times a week, not joking.

_PhsvtHo47MX2FYLcbwQiQ.text: I love this place for 2 main reasons. First, the food is delicious. I recommend the lamb souvlaki and the Great Greek Bowl with falafel. Their hummus is so creamy and light, I could have it every day. So much flavor with everything, we were pretty much quiet the whole meal bc we didn't want to do anything but eat! Two, the portion size is phenomenal for the price you pay; you definitely get your value/ money's worth. The ambience is cute, fresh and clean and the staff is very friendly. I liked seeing that they enjoyed their job and being there while we were having our meal, it was just a nice extra touch. Outdoor seating is available and the dining room feels like you're eating at your place or a friend's house. Worth a try!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lamb souvlaki: only $11 for this good portion size!!
Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Greek Bowl with falafel; only $10 for this huge thing!!

AHvoWAeYjyPcTyqGaTwZkA.text: Good food with too much salt. I ordered delivery and got the lemon orzo soup as well as the lamb with rice. It came with a little salad and tzaziki. The soup was really thick and salty, which was a bummer because I love that soup. The chicken was like Campbell's chicken - those tiny little bits in an oily, thick broth. I won't get that again. However, their lamb was cooked really well to my liking. I ordered it medium rare, and it was just that. It soaked into the rice a bit, making both better. I think they could do with less salt overall, and maybe let the juices drip even more into the rice. I remember that from the Greek food festival - it made everything better. They could also make their tzaziki a bit more dynamic with more dill and cucumber. However, I'm excited to try their other items in the future.

wnSVF9xTe6i5gHgp7Dk_qQ.text: This is one of my favorite places to have delivered.  It is amazing and healthy.  The chicken and steak kabobs are off the charts.  The salad is great and the grape leaves are yummy.  If you're looking for a healthy and great meal you have to try this place.  I'm so glad it is close to home.

bN3CVz4HW47Ia8OTeIIljA.text: I had been wanting to try this place for lunch after a coworker's recommendation. Since it's a little over 10 minutes from my office, I decided to try ordering from Grubhub for the first time. Before I placed my order it said "total time will be 30-40 mins". AFTER I placed the order it turned into 90 mins! Yikes! So.. I decided to cancel my Grubhub order and just go to the place directly.  I drive the 10+ minutes, park, and when I walk inside there is a huuuge line and only one person working the counter. I'm waiting for at least 10 minutes which seems silly - why not have at least one more person working the register so they can handle the crowd more? On top of that, the person at the counter was also taking ordering calls so we had to wait for her to finish making the line move even slower. I was almost ready to bail but since I had waited this long (and made the trek), I decided to stay.  When I finally got up to the front, ordering was thankfully fairly smooth. I got my food to go and when I asked, I was told it would be another 15 minutes for it to be ready. I wish the lady behind the counter would have volunteered that information instead of me having to ask after I placed the order. But once again, I'm already committed, so might as well ..   Ordering food to-go is kind of weird because they don't give you a number and there's really no where to sit and wait. I didn't want to take up a spot at the table for people dining in since it was already crowded, but I didn't want to stand because it was gonna be at least 15 minutes? So the whole thing just felt weird and clunky. I saw a lot of people get to-go orders so I would have thought they'd have a better process.  After a few minutes, I decided to check on my order, and I found that my original Grubhub order was actually made instead of being cancelled. I panicked because I had just placed an order for the same exact thing. The lady at the register assured me my order had been cancelled and so I wouldn't be charged (even though it was made). At the same time, the order I had placed a few minutes ago came out, so she packaged that. While I thought she would just give me the second cancelled order as a nice gesture since it was already there and ready, she instead put it to the side and had zero interest in offering it to me. This was a huge disappointment as other places happily offer me "mistake orders" all the time. I mean the food wasn't cheap to begin with. But, since I had to get back to work, I didn't want to fight it.  And as for the food? It was just okay, but definitely not worth the hassle. The steak was decent but the lamb was super tough. I got it medium - which the lady recommended - so I don't know if it should have been cooked less or what. I was also REALLY hyped about the feta fries, but when I got them they were way too cheesy. They also didn't taste very feta to me? If you love cheese then you'll be fine, but if you're looking for more crispy fries with feta accents (like other places I've been to), I think you'll be disappointed.  Overall I'm hesitant to recommend this place for lunch. If you do, order ahead or be prepared for a long wait.

wgImBxCglESrSJjHwo5NQA.text: Excellent Excellent food!!  But the young man (cashier) was really rude. They just need to work more in their customer service.

BiuUubIdbwZ6F-OxEiW7fA.text: Good food, good portions. Clean, fresh decor. Usually get the Greek salad with gyro meat. Kids meal options are good. Chicken fingers are always hot, fresh and juicy.

qE3DEu5CVJAPrJn9OvZT0Q.text: Got the Gyro plate and was shocked by the portion. It usually takes a lot to fill me up, but I found myself full and satisfied with food left to take home for later.   The meat was delicious, rice cooked perfectly, and the pita bread was warm and soft.   Salad was also fresh and crunchy.   Can't beat the quality and quantity for the price!

YAl6FOhhJQdRUhJfL4u7Hw.text: Came here based on their good reviews and the convenient location. However, I didn't have the same experience. I came with the expectations of another similar Greek restaurant. I love the grilled chicken/shrimp Greek salad from the restaurant I usually go to so of course I had to try it here. The chicken skewer here was extremely dry, no flavor to them at all, almost like they were over cooked. The salad was alright, lettuce was extremely huge so I had to cut them down with a knife to eat them comfortably. Overall I just wasn't too impressed with the salad that I love so dearly at the other restaurant. Perhaps maybe I'll try their other meat options next time if I ever decide to come back.   They were very busy during dinner time so maybe I might've just had a bad batch of chicken that night.

uJ7DQvHYAPe4zdKWwh-lbg.text: I love this place and whenever I am in town I make sure I go there. The food is awesome and the staff are very friendly and make you feel welcome.  I ordered the small Greek salad with chicken and it was fresh and huge!! The dressing is just right not too overpowering with the right amount of spices. The chicken is cooked perfectly and not overdone.  Thanks for another delicious meal

pHaCXetb6_9l5bQJZv-IWQ.text: We recieved the recommendation for The Great Greek as we were on the opposite side of the city and we were very glad we went.  For a fast casual, the food was excellent and so was the service.   We tried the lamb chop special which was great, gyro plate as well as sandwich, the burger, fries, hummus and baklava.   Everything we had was really good as we share family style and the environment was very comfortable to sit and talk after our meal.

9ZOwZv4lesKO4Cdhy4MyOA.text: Living in the southwest, it's really hard to find a good greek gyro place. I'm from Chicago and the gyro here reminded me of back home. Friendly staff and great customer service.

fT2bVz6ZjOxnfhKT4Pm-pw.text: Love this new place. The food and service was great and the venue is tastefully decorated. Cheap and cheerful.

EPeoVNtaLg-HKv5LE8RnXw.text: The service was incredible and friendly!  The food was so fresh and authentic!  DEFINITELY my new go to for Greek food! Perfect portions! Such great vibes as well!  Loved the decor and cleanliness.  I will be back :)

Y9xkyjAXqubP8MljXJVF5Q.text: I got the chicken kabob meal. Everything tasted fresh and good...I got two meals out of one. An excellent value!

yoM70FZD9iIy376GnEQuKQ.text: Greeeeeeat Greek food in the city. At first, I was a bit concerned about the food not being as good as the Henderson location. The food was consistent!!! This makes me very happy, as this location is closer to my house. Very very fresh food, great flavor and excellent service. Try the chicken rice bowl. It's amazing! And, always order hummus ;-)

W1-e9SEbJ5gGa_SQyqePVw.text: Slow service and incredibly rude customer service too. Person was on their phone the whole time. Never coming back. Don't recommend. Wait time and ugly attitude isn't worth the food.

v2EVrlC99bO3qaE8t8N0EQ.text: My absolute go to! These guys are so friendly and the food is delish. The four dips with pita are everything. Their rice pudding is one of the best I've ever had (don't tell my Mom). I've yet to try a dish that doesn't meet or surpass my expectations. Keep doing what you're doing! You guys are awesome.  P.S. Sergio from EBC says 'Hi'! :)

0GQ9SxCmtMgQJfCLpGrhmg.text: Great place to eat! The food is really tasty and good portion sizes. One of my favorite places to drop in when I don't feel like cooking dinner.

MmMfrq4A1fHVwANmfLsQ0g.text: Writing this as I wait for my son to finish up his meal here. I couldn't leave without making sure to say just how fantastic this place is! The menu has a nice variety and makes it easy for vegetarians & vegans with little symbols on their items. Staff were all friendly and knowledgeable. The restaurant is clean & tidy and they have plenty of seating, including an outdoor patio. Our table tried the Greek salad, a falafel pita,the mezze plate (enough for two to share or one as a meal if you want to try a bit of everything vegetarian) and the baklava. We had zero complaints and will definitely be back!

zvewQxpLIGLVytPvnp32Wg.text: Not sure why this place is currently 3.5 stars! This is my new go-to fresh restaurant. The first time I came I loved their juicy gyro plate and today I had a large Greek salad with the falafel and a side of hummus. The presentation of the plates makes your mouth water before you even start! Everything looks fresh. The falafel are better than Crazy Pita and the salad was crispy and not overly dressed. Any time I want a fresh, healthy meal and I don't want to cook, I'm coming here. Oh, and my dining companion pointed out the plates and silverware are all machine washable, so they are helping the environment, too!

zyJFIOvac7x8l3PNhioEyQ.text: I can't believe some of the sub par ratings here. Service was amazing! I just ordered take out but they gave me water while I waited and extra to-go supplies so I could bring some for lunch tomorrow. Food was super good. This is fast casual people! I'd say it's like Pei Wei for Mediterranean.

ggvMrT2q7HxVektMEMc3iw.text: Good food but too many times we have missing items from our order! So frustrating! So we either have to go without sauces or humus ect... or go back at a later time for refund. What a hassle! A small family owned business should have better QC than this! Honestly we've just stop ordering from here.

h-OKZUASWVneQh3l1LLLew.text: Too Expansive for a casual dining fast food restaurant.  We ordered gyro sandwich and chicken kabob plate and gyro was excessively covered with white sauce....can't taste the meat , gross! My husband's dish was nothing to wow about ether, just an average place . Will not return.

l1gcEnwbIWBkG2I2NJd8lg.text: Love this place! Great service and great food! Been im here twice in less than 24 hrs.

PGOlnzqfRJSu7RS6uxfI2w.text: We've visited this location 3 times now and each time the food has been delicious, very clean inside and never a long wait. I can only comment on the salads & skewers because it's the only thing we've tried. But we keeping back for them!!! I can't wait to try some other menu items.

8ICOjEa21Wq4ZBJbZg5MJQ.text: I really like this place. 2 times in the last 5 days good. I have had the steak traditional plate w/ feta/mozzarella fries(omg best fries I think I have ever had), side greek salad. Yesterday I had the small greek salad w/ chicken and steak skewer and a side of feta/mozzarella fries. I love Stephanos but, Great Greek has just been put on my radar. I stayed away for the first few weeks due to the reviews. Well either they just had some opening pains or people are morons. Either way "Great Greek Fam" amazing job and I love how hard you all work to make this place somewhere we can grab something not so unhealthy other than the feta fries but, omg I can't those fries are so dang good keep it up!

vlW0YsE6KmBDtdUQz646KQ.text: Went to great greek with a group on Saturday and ordered the chicken Shawarma Salad, the Beef and Lamb Gyro fries hummus and Tatziki. Overall the meal was great and everything seemed awesome. Until night time 3/4 people in our group all had extreme stomach discomfort. We were all sharing food so I can't pin point exactly which dish did this to us but we hadn't eaten anything else the rest of the day so we are guessing it was the food we had.

aG7U0PpWT_C6G6z_hxYaHw.text: Well, this was a surprise!  The husband and I were craving Greek food and he remembered seeing this place "coming soon" not too far from the house. We swung by tonight and, in all honesty, I was expecting decent grub and a so-so atmosphere. It was far better than that.  The place itself is very nicely put together, especially considering it falls under the "fast casual" umbrella. Beautiful wood on the walls, lots of planters, nice lighting, lovely tables all with vases and fresh flowers. It was very inviting. Also, food is served on real plates with real silverware and the plates have a kind of pottery look and feel to them which adds to the overall effect.  But more importantly - the food!  We ordered two gyro combos; my husband's had feta mine didn't. Both were the lamb/beef combo with juicy fresh tomatoes, red onion, deliciously fluffy and thick tzatziki sauce, and a scrumptiously fluffy pita to hold it all together. Guys, it was phenomenal! Meat was tender and delicious, veggies were on point, and the sauce was addictive.  I had rice pilaf as a side (yummy!) and the hubs had the feta fries. The feta fries were a revelation. Perfect spuds with feta and tons of oregano mixed throughout (I hate it when there's only cheese on top!) and cooked together into a creamy, gooey, crispy, unctuous mass of magic. I stole many of his fries and husband is a good man because he let me.   We also got some eggplant dip as an appetizer and it was very good. All good was ordered at the counter but brought to your table. Service was wonderful, extremely friendly and genuine.  I short, I'd go back in a heartbeat. The only problem is deciding whether to eat that amazing gyro again or try something else because the whole menu looks awesome.

oew5CRJDTfixxcRJjVHpfw.text: I stoped by on my way out of Vegas towards LA and wanted to get a healthy salad ... and found this guys on Yelp. Fantastic food .... great service.... lovely staff! Highly recommend this place. The salad was very fresh and the sandwich was delicious. The person behind the cash was very helpfully recommending options to me !

20--Q3HlBy6tNsLFImxIwg.text: A little pricey but worth the bang for the buck. I love the French Fries. Nice clean place very friendly and great service.

7F_cvqRwoqeF2YPfU4MmDA.text: I was so excited when we got a Great Greek next to us. The small Greek salad is huge and more than enough food to feel you up. The baklava is so good even the next day if you take home.

zLtI6N4bje3ryRmDl2g7_Q.text: So glad there is a Greek place near me now! The decor is really pretty! Bright and clean, tons of tables and seating options, tables and chairs were clean modern looking.   I got the Gyro plate which was really good. Meat was not too salty, fries were crunchy, salad was fresh, sauces were delicious. My brother got the garlic shrimp and loved it, the rice smelled amazing and tasted great. I like that their plates and silverware looked nicer than you would expect it to, not paper plates or cheap looking plasticware. This is great for pictures :)   First experience here was great, will definitely come back to try other dishes.

JAnhDXoRodtR2EVFmzNu4w.text: Standard Greek takeout food but with sit-down restaurant wait times to get your food. Staff seems a bit frazzled and confused.  Menu is made up of gyros, casseroles and salads with rice pilaf or fries (the good kind, not garbage Ore-Ida crinkle fries cut like Raisin' Canes.)  Food is pretty standard, tastes like Kronos gyro meat. Prices average about $10 per person. Dining room gets extremely busy at dinner time so maybe order ahead to go to avoid fighting for a table.

xjxQDIu5asHF23N-pQMC5g.text: Trying out a new Greek restaurant! We ordered a beef/lamb gyro and a lamb wrap. The gyro was pretty good but I wasn't really a fan on thw wrap. I thought it was ok. I wish they could have add more ingredient to the wrap though such as rice or some more lettuce. All I tasted on my wrap was alot of sauce and lamb.. overall, it was ok for me but my husband loves the gyro that he ordered. The area is very easy to find and the restaurant is pretty spacious. It's not like a togo place.

Now that I moved closer to Blue diamond I was really excited to see that they decided to expand! The food is still consistent with the right flavor and portions. I love that this new location is larger. I usually order the chicken gyro with feta fries and my hubby gets the gyro plate which also comes with a salad. The prices are reasonable with the amount and quality of food you get. Great service that is always welcoming. I support these family businesses.

0SIgULOM2zYNMwoTAm45OQ.text: Great is what it is, this place was very fresh and delicious!! The tzatziki sauce is so refreshing I was dipping everything in it! This place has such a great concept I hope they open one in New York!!

JDptbYflZfqjSqaKtlBkMQ.text: I really enjoy having lunch at this place the gyro's are very good and quite large. The employees are very friendly, and service is quick.

w5yB-Md1eqGVlrIdWu7V2g.text: Great, fresh, consistent food. We literally eat here 1-2 times per week. Salads are fantastic and my husband loves the gyro bowl. Pita is warm and soft, Greek fries are amazing!!!! Kids meals satisfy my picky eater and she loves the chicken lemon soup! Two gripes: olives inconsistently have pits and I can tell when I ask for no tomatoes they pick them off my salad because there's tomato seeds on my salad. Minor things and we still love this place.

Kb-Y5yFwWcbgOtBJa_gVfA.text: This has become my go-to place for Greek food.  Fresh, fast, large portions. I always get the KIDS size because once I got the regular portion and I had enough for 2 meals (which is not a bad thing). I have gotten the Gyro sandwich and platter from the Kid's menu with the salad and fries as sides. I have also tried their lemon chicken soup, which I think would be wonderful when you are feeling sick. Don't forget to get the Greek cookie to finish your meal! They are yummy! I have only taken my meal to-go but the restaurant is clean with a very nice design. You order at the counter and they bring out your food. They also clear your plates when you are done. Overall, I highly recommend them. I look forward to trying something new on their menu the next time I visit!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids gyro platter with rice pilaf and salad. It&#39;s huge!
Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids gyro with rice pilaf. The gyro is usually has tomatoes, onions, lettuce, and feta. I hate tomatoes and raw onions so I omitted them.

PDM9nyFyKh7qvbe4jR3Enw.text: We visited for the first time yesterday (7/13/17) around 4PM prior to the dinner rush.  The restaurant is clean, with a modern/minimalist interior.  We frequent Greek/Mediterranian establishments quite often due to our diets, and this has risen quickly to the upper ranks of our list.  You go to the counter to order, and the food is brought to the table by a runner.  Drinks are self serve.  The tea is fresh brewed, so that's a huge plus.  All of the staff members were super friendly and helpful.   The menu has a large variety including avgolemono soup, all types of skewers, and even baklava ice cream.  Prices are very reasonable.  An add-on skewer (shrimp, chicken, lamb, beef, salmon) is only $3.75. The kid's menu is fantastic.  They offer gyros and skewers, not just the usual chicken tenders kid's fare.  As someone who has a very restricted diet, I appreciate that I can get skewers separately or a decent kid's plate without a hassle or a weird upcharge.  I got the plated gyro from the kid menu and my husband got the regular gyro plate.  He substituted additional salad for rice at the suggestion of staff.  It has to have been one of the freshest salads I've seen in town.  I don't even like tomatoes, but they looked glorious.  My kid plate was larger than I expected.  I don't know that it would be a full meal for most adults, but it would definitely not fall too short.  The food was fresh, super tasty, and very filling.  The Tzatziki was wonderful. The gyro meat was nicely carved and wasn't overly seasoned.  The pita was not as soft as I would have liked, but not because it was old or stale. I believe it may have been baked just a little too long.  Overall it was a nice experience and very convenient for the SW end of town. I look forward to a return visit to try the skewers and soup.

JOm-XZXNw7wW-5XI6BeIPw.text: The food is always fresh and delicious. My picky kids will eat their entire plate of chicken and lemon rice. Great healthy food!

C8Ndyn05NsutqaTKYf8CmQ.text: Our first time here and the guy thoroughly and patiently went over the menu. My husband loved his Gyro and I loved my lamb chops. So tender! So delicious! Huge portions. We shared The Baklava ice cream. The guy who went over the menu came over to check if we were happy with our selections. Great service!

cswO8vOQ9xLqWz8fOtx9rA.text: Happy that they opened something different on this side of town.  My fiance and I tried the traditional Greek beef/lamb gyro and they definitely didn't disappoint.   Get ready to eat with both hands because the Gyros are packed with meat.   Look forward to coming back and trying other things on the menu.

vxpbQ4cRVcQZwcmpLH1rpA.text: The Great Greek is super delicious and well priced!! I recommend getting the avgolemono soup which is a creamy, lemon, chicken soup! For 3.75 a bowl you can't beat it, even comes with complimentary pita bread. I also tried their great Greek gyro which had tender meat, a well flavored tzatziki, and a generous amount of feta. Lastly, my boyfriend tried their steak souvlaki plate that came with rice and a side salad. He said his steak was perfectly seasoned and cooked.  *** Bottom Line: The Great Greek provides well flavored food, good-sized portions, friendly service, and fair prices!

JV27FkRcPAEeqM39Q2W85g.text: Best Greek spot in town, hands down! The food never disappoints and I'm speaking for both this and the original location in Henderson. Their salads have so much flavor, the gyros are crave worthy, the feta fries. Yeah, I'm gonna just leave that there.   My girlfriend and I usually get the souvlaki (chicken, steak and/or lamb) plate and it is so satisfying, and for the price, you really can't beat it. The staff are also very friendly and efficient. If you don't like to wait, I suggest you call in your order for takeout as it usually takes about 10-15 mins for them to have your food ready. Hey? At least you know it's fresh! But personally, I think it's well worth the wait. Enjoy!

h0TJZKxHQtlicDqB1W_J3Q.text: Two stars for their bomb ass sauce! But oh man! What to start with...  The girl that was helping us out was really nice and knowledgeable with the menu. My main complain is the bowl itself. For almost $12, you get a SMALL skewer of DRY chicken, rice & the cucumber and veggies. So basically, the whole bowl is 80% rice 15% veggies and 5% meat. The chicken was very dry and was hard to eat. Although once the sauce has been added, it's good. Overall, wouldn't go back to this place. Too pricey for the quality of food

igeaU4uVrBijLRxPwdNIsA.text: Fresh & delicious. Shrimp rice bowl with extra chicken skewer. Tzaziki is the best! Love their shrimp, which I normally never order out. Chicken is always moist, not dried out. Highly recommend

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bv1-ifGStnqNyhL_IXVIig.text: The Great Greek is amazing. They never disappoint! The food always tastes fresh and delicious and they are very consistent about it. I always order the small salad (more than enough for 1 person) with a skewer of some kind (chicken or beef, both always so tender and juicy). Their garlic feta fries are also a must-have every time.   I've probably eaten there 10 times and I still have yet to explore the rest of their menu, but I'm confident it's all good!  The SW is blessed to have this restaurant in the area.

j9kZznh_U81IhUSF8AH1_w.text: Greek salad with Jumbo grilled shrimp was excellent!  Yummy hummus appetizer with fresh warm pita... sooo good!

cCzntVbiWp9vEjRBlls1Mg.text: I've ordered out from here quite a few times and have not been disappointed yet. The service is fast given that this location is always quite busy no matter what time of day you come in. The traditional gyro combo is always a big hit .

eYrwOEp2xQxEAr-9WM2xjw.text: Love! Love! Love! I cant get enough of this place.  I really love the feta gyro!  The service is quick too which makes it nice when in a hurry

2wVxA7HrRdKFTDWzXlKbUg.text: This place is AWESOME!!  I have been waiting for good Greek food to come to the Southwest and it is finally here.  The food is the freshest in Las Vegas.  I had the Great Greek Gyro and it was packed with flavorful beef/lamb meat.  It is clear that they make their own tzatziki sauce because it was just so fresh and tasty.  The cashier talked me into the feta fries and I will be indebted to her forever.  They are a must get every time.  My wife had a salad with a chicken skewer.  She hasn't stopped talking about it.  The veggies were so fresh and the chicken was tender and had great flavor.  Do yourself a favor and save some room for dessert.  The rice pudding and baklava ice cream are both outstanding.    The restaurant is clean and the decor is very tasteful.   The staff is super friendly and helpful and I just absolutely love this place.  Thanks Great Greek for making this my new favorite restaurant.

achTde0XNusxsD6zfrzbBg.text: Excellent food, good prices and great customer service.  I will be making this a regular stop

1Je07NycW8XZJBhnr39hzw.text: Its great to have a new cuisine in the area off Blue Diamond, if you are in the area you know the choices aren't vast. With that said The Great Greek Mediterranean Grill in my opinion is not the greatest Greek you can get in town. Meraki Greek Grill or Shish Kabob House is a much fresher choice for the same value. I found the Grilled Chicken Souvlaki plate ($14.02 w/tax) at the Great Greek to be dry and mildly flavorful. The rice pilaf was cooked properly and probably my favorite part of the dish. The feta on the salad was fresh as well as the other ingredients, olive garden should ask for their vinaigrette recipe its pretty dang good! So I would have to give their salad an A+. I would cover dessert but when I was in line ordering I asked if I could get a order of Baklava but I was informed they where out (this was at about 8:15 pm they close at 9 pm). A customer behind me, which ordered (5) orders of baklava ice cream told me that the baklava dessert was awesome, sad to say I didn't get to try it. That actually might get me to go back on another night when I want a quick and easy fix for some Greek food, that and the salad. Other than that I am traveling to Meraki off Trop and rainbow. The Great Greek does stay open a little later than others so that is another plus and actually the reason I tried them in the first place, as Meraki closes at 8:30 pm. the owner was there the night I came in, great operator, friendly staff, clean establishment. I want to give this establishment a higher rating but the food was just not there for me.

YXUOK7MpBHXidOU7NGM-UA.text: Excellent food, I always have to stop by when I'm in the area. I love their gyros because they definitely don't skimp on the meat. And it isn't overly salty like many Greek/Mediterranean places I've been to. You also have to try the baklava... Amazing!

3JCyca0F5_MVtLtagY9UAA.text: Today I'm having the Greek salad with a side of hummus it was good the gyro was better and the service was good

j5c1H4y2aXl7F-X9ZAmBDg.text: Love , Love, Love this place!  Best greek food in town.  Glad they opened on this side of town. Because I usually drive to Henderson to get my greek fix at their original location.

GT5uYu8PTUZGyV0ehSC0AQ.text: The feta fries are amazing and it's the best baklava I have ever had. The place just opened today but they clearly have their act together. I will for sure be coming back often. Everything my family ordered was great.....yes I tasted everyone's plate. Hahaha
