d_EerDEPYEuO_OSJemZ6Jg.text: Says they're open till 9pm, closed at 7pm. Please fix your hours on yelp and your website and your door. What a waste of a fresh new spot in southern highlands.

4yQaY-mxiXqEXmP-C1vZxQ.text: Poor service, forgot item in to go order. Manager confirmed everything was there. Had to go back to get missing item. Asked for free small side of hummus for having to drive back and get the item they forgot. They refused and wanted to charge me for a small side. Very surprised for the inconvenience and lack of wanting to make up for their mistake. Not the best way to start out in a new area.

ROe7gAAYZuw7AmtFyLgbcA.text: My coworkers and I ordered here for lunch. I got the greek bowl with the gyro meat. EXCELLENT! We all were greatly pleased! Only wish they delivered.

QyBPouKRiEM7w8Y125a3Ng.text: Home run for anyone who loves Greek. We finished a fun day mountain biking and climbing and we're looking for a good, healthy dinner. Fresh, crisp Greek salad, rice plate and Mezze plate was a homerun.

HsQH-QRi9bM-Hmy2t9Il9Q.text: Excellent food. I took a group of friends (14) there this past week. All agreed the food was hot and delicious. There are large portions. This is a walk up but you are served almost immediately at your table and the food is hot, cooked to order. I have to keep saying that it's hot because so many fast food locations give you "almost" warm food.  My lamb was cooked perfectly. Others said the beef was excellent. Gyros were huge! The salads were fresh and the employees were friendly and helpful.

qlwPZfXAOHsHYgPoZdA45Q.text: Eat anything on the menu! Delicious! I have visited this place three times in one week! That rice bowl is to die for, it has the perfect rice, salad ratio.

EPFTkIV10sTo-3hESIArFA.text: This place is fantastic....so fresh and tasty.  Love this place and the staff is always on it.  Great menu.  Whats not to like about the Great Greek.

Lsr44ec28aC_eZlz-em9bw.text: Great place for a casual lunch! We got the gyro plate with the feta fries. The feta fries were amazing!

FrX8sPwFbPBu_Es-5G1WCQ.text: Was really excited to have a Greek place close to home but after trying was a little disappointed. Ordered the Rice Bowl. Not sure why they called it that considering there was barely any rice yet there was a lot of greens which was fresh but it drowned out the rice and you couldn't even tell if the rice had any good flavor. Had the steak with the rice bowl and asked for medium but instead got way well done not to mention it was so little meat it really wasn't even worth adding to all the greens and barely any rice. I also added the Mezze Plate so I could try a few of my favorite Greek items. The Spanakopita was the best I've ever had, the Dolmades were really tiny and had no flavor, the Falafels were really dark brown which I can assume was way over cooked, the Tzatziki sauce was watery, and the Hummus was extremely lemony. I love lemon but not as the main taste in my hummus. I guess I won't be having Greek food so close to home after all because I won't be going back anytime soon.

9vjpicAXLUCAa81lb_0oQg.text: So good! Very clean place, food is fresh, healthy, and meat is tender. Absolutely love it!

mfB_UJuItWIa7qLqqqW4Mw.text: So happy to have a new restaurant in the area that isn't fast food. The chicken gyros here are amazing. Nicely seasoned and juicy.

o1ZcH73kr4ZwWANSAczHog.text: We had a couple Great Greek Gyro Combos and a salad with the dip combo delivered and it was amazing! We have never had a bad meal from here, The food is always fresh and  delicious!  I highly recommend!

HAKuPf0M_mlXOG199VNrZw.text: Hmmmmm... It was very OK only.  Decided to give them a try and we were sorely disappointed.  My fiance and both ordered chicken.  Both were tasty but very dry.  The rice was not flavorful. The feta fries were good but not better than other places.  Overall... we decided we wouldn't be returning customers.  Sorry.  We cannot recommend.

vfQHibB32wjKSZ84aQ-zfQ.text: BS +++  Holy Greek.  I am very fond of good grilled food.  As soon as I saw this place I was curious.  I've been eating lots of fried foods and I want to see what the buzz was all about.  Holy yum. Me and my wife had the salmon salad, grape leaf wraps, and I got the chicken gyro.  The portions was just right and the meat was cooked to perfection.  The prices here are super good and the wait staff was friendly.  If you're a vegetarian or a omnivore like myself this place has all the right choices.  I'm a foodie from NYC and trust me this is authentic Greek food.    * Boomsauce scale. BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage). Not recommended. BS = it's just O.K. (experience) BS+ = Yo! I like this place. BS++= That's Whoa! This place good. BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE!

96uYQ4LGofdFT6nTCT1DRA.text: My husband and I picked up dinner here last night. I had the gyro meal and my husband had the lamb. We got the rice and the feta fries. Also tried the ice cream. We also got some spanakopita.  The staff was very friendly and helpful. The food was quick to be ready. Everything was delicious. My favorite was the spanakopita. Everything was awesome. Will definitely be back

r3YaLYj10E8lu29A7v9xwA.text: I love this place! Great Greek has always been one of my favorite Greek restaurants. My boyfriend and I used to go to their Henderson location whenever we were in the area; so I was extremely happy when I found out that they expanded and is now much closer to us. No matter when we come in, Great Greek has always been consistent with their delicious and flavorful food. The prices are reasonable and everything is made fresh to order. In addition, the staff are super friendly and the service is fast. My go-to order is the grilled chicken souvlaki (with rice) that comes with a small Greek salad and my boyfriend loves getting the Great Greek Gyro (with chicken) and feta fries. We also love to order the Tzatziki dip with extra pita bread.   My boyfriend and I came in on a Wednesday night to order take out. Although the restaurant was packed, we placed our usual order and didn't wait long at all. We brought our food back home and loved every bit of it. With the portions being huge and filling, I brought my leftovers to work the next day. I wasn't surprised at all that it still tasted as good as if you were to pick it up from the restaurant that day. I definitely recommend this place! We will be back again and again.

6JcIioXYjvOeOyQFhmyNUQ.text: I love watching the show The Profit. He struggled with the owner of this restaurant, but made it look much better. I had very high expectations having read the reviews, BUT, the service was horrible, when I asked for lamb souvlaki, the cashier says 'You know that it's two dollars extra!' Of course, I said no!, because it doesn't say that anywhere on the board. Basically, the menu board is useless as it doesn't provide much information. And then, the kid brings out the food, slides it across the table and doesn't even ask if I might need anything. For the cost, I definitely expected better service and some flavor to the food. The lamb didn't taste roasted and the yogurt dressing didn't taste of garlic. Very bland food for $20. Anywhere else would have been better.  Thanks for your reply Nick D. (Owner), I actually struggle to believe that any other day that the service, or the food, would have been good. I'm willing to bet that it wouldn't be different even if I was to come back. I would be willing to return though to meet Marcus Limonis.   Tonight, I'm cooking my own lamb dinner. A big box store did all of the preparation and it comes out very tasty each and every time. As you can see,?I'm not a betting man. I like to go with the sure thing.   To be very clear, I resent finding out that something that I order is more expensive than on the menu when I arrive at the register. This makes me feel duped. I'm marking down my review of your restaurant for making me feel this way.   I left the Napa Valley town of Yountville where the meal prices ARE very high, but they but the cost on the menu anyway. And there, the food always surpasses expectations. I would have liked for The Great Greek restaurant's food to at least meet my expectations, with as high as it was promoted. Underline promoted.

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XPR3u6nFECXddXPYcjGbfQ.text: Finally more and more restaurants are opening up in this neighborhood!. This little restaurant opened up nearby not too long ago. We were excited to finally dine. It was a moderate size, packed, and very clean. The menu seemed to be a standard Greek menu, but a few tasty standouts, such as Baklava Ice Cream and the Feta Fries.  We ordered the Great Greek Gyro with Lamb, the traditional gyro with beef, feta fries, and baklava ice cream. For our son we ordered the awesome grilled cheese pita. the grilled cheese pita is an awesome idea, easy to eat and not too messy. My only complaint is they use processed cheese. The food was delicious. In fact after this we returned several times which  prompted me to write this review. The staff are friendly. Service is quick. Very good atmosphere.

FwD6L3ezP8_eBagtLj7iGQ.text: Yes, I am a regular at this joint. I have been a regular at their other location too but I was compelled to review again after tasting the baklava ice-cream I recently discovered. I wish they have a larger variety week over week of their lunch specials but I guess the Lamb Chops is also a good option when you are in that special mood. Feta fries are a must and their spreads are amazing too. Don't be shy and always take something to go :)

trQI2qIbbuGcmQw3wh0-5g.text: I have been in Vegas for 20 years originally from the south side of Chicago and this is hands down the best food I have found here! Gyro plate well done with rice and salad! Skip the spanakopita! Service is great! I'm so happy!!!! We will be back!

NtSVQsZpkcxHlWtf2vSk3g.text: Came here for lunch yesterday.  First time here.  Looking for comfort food with a dog friendly atmosphere and ended up here.   I had the chicken kabob plate with feta fries. It came with a side salad. The wait time wasn't that bad after ordering.   Dog friendly patio makes me happy. I love bringing my dog wherever I go if possible.   I would definitely come back and get other things on the menu.   Parking lot.  Casual dining. Indoor and outdoor seating.  I'm a fan.

2mhJm8o0hF9cPy8s4inp2g.text: Came here for lunch today to grab something somewhat healthy. I like how they have a generous portion of salad even if you get a small salad. I ordered a small salad and a steak skewer. The steak skewer is $3.75 on top of the salad which is $5.95.   It's nice because if you eat there they will bring your food to you, but since it was my first time ordering the salad I didn't know they were supposed to give you the dressing on the side. If my friend didn't say anything I wouldn't have known, which is why they got a four start instead of a five star.   The steak was good and they even provide you with naan and tzatziki sauce. Not sure how you spell it. The salad had an abundance of onions and oversized tomatoes which I didn't enjoy.   Overall, the food was good and the service was average. I'd come back again to try their other items on the menu.

iUM64IA0L9i3C0zcitkGZQ.text: Great fresh food! I usually get the greek salad with gyro meat. The feta fries are so yumm! They really dont skimp on the feta! I recommend to eat in versus take out. Sometimes we order through grub hub or uber eats style services and the food isnt as fresh tasting. Food is procey but worth it

VfVk0lejZs061PG-4UxisA.text: Me and my husband love Greek food, whenever we go to a new city we always look for Greek restaurants. We tried the beef and lamp gyros, feta fries and the the rice and I must say this is one of the best gyros I have tried. The sauce tasted delicious, great flavor. I highly recommend the feta fries. Also the customer service was great, I didn't catch the cashiers name but he was very polite and welcoming. The restaurant was also very clean, I loved the table decor. Next time we come to Vegas again we will definitely be stopping by to get some Greek food from here.

odBimejvrtys4gX4FV20PA.text: Omg this place is amazing the staff the food the prices. My new best place and the food is to die for

ilX6nXEEOflKsi-yOljBUg.text: I stumbled upon this restaurant when the wife and I were out running errands. I had been craving Greek food for a while and decided to give it a try.....boy am I thankful I did! As soon as we walked in...it was clean and refreshing! The Vegas summer has been kicking our bum...but it was comfortable the moment we walked in the door. The first thing I noticed, was how nice the decor is and how well kept the location is. I was excited to get to the counter.   Since I hadn't been here before, I stared at the menu in amazement...I feel the young lass at the counter is used to the shock on new faces...so she advised I grab a menu and make myself at home at a table...excellent idea! The wife and I sat down and looked over all of the delicious options.....thankfully she pulled me back...or I would have ordered two of everything!   Everything sounded beyond appetizing! We decided on a few appetizers, a salad, and some fries, but then I noticed they were offering a special that included a few of the items we were ordering. So we decided to get that and split it. I wanted the greek salad, hummus, and fires....but I was worried that us splitting the meal would leave us hungry.....boy was I wrong!!!!  The ladies behind the front counter continued to bring us parts of our order, as soon as they were ready...and I thought it would never end! I do wish the tomatoes for the salad were cut a tad smaller.....but that's just because I need to be able to shovel the yummy foods in faster!   Everything we tried was fresh and more than I expected for the prices. Our table was cleaned as soon as we finished each plate, and everyone was beyond kind and helpful. I look forward to making another trip here very soon and highly recommend you do as well!

rE40ELHaw5QKwLyk4xVjQg.text: Very nice Greek restaurant on Blue Diamond and Decatur. Near Fruits & Roots and Capriotti Sandwich. They have a nice size patio and parking lot. I like that they had some Franks Hot sauce, Sriracha & Tapatio available

Lx_F_mXwPv3cVudLCERpfA.text: This really is 'Great Greek'. Hubby and I popped in for mid-week dinner to go. I got a grilled chicken gyro with feta fries, he got a grilled chicken plate. Both were really good! The cheese on the feta fries had gotten a little cold by the time we made it home but they were still pretty tasty! We also ordered a side of dolmades, which leads to the -1 star, they were out of dolmades so she offered hummus instead which was priced less than the dolmades. We didn't make a big deal about it because we paid with a card and it would have been more hassle to refund such a small amount so we just ate it. Plus the hummus ended up being good anyway!! Over all I will definitely be visiting again!

cBUh8hH9g1nz51opRdOvGQ.text: It was a total lark that I stumbled upon this place. I was driving down Blue Diamond and saw it from the street. My wife and I turned in and both got the Gyro plate. It was quite delicious. The meat was flavorful and sliced thin. The salad that came with it was more than just iceberg lettuce and dressing like some places. It had cucumber, tomato, feta cheese, and red onion. The rice pilaf was tender as well. The pita that came with it was soft and fresh. We would totally recommend this place and even though it is quite a ways from us, we are planning on a return trip.

CbluOomthxnECpMesk8ghg.text: Great place to pop in for yummy food. Wish they would open one in Summerlin I would be here weekly.

tqFNoq1Rnet-Hgwp1Vv2fg.text: Nice to have Greek food on this side of town. Build out is very clean n modern. Food was very tasty. I ordered a gyro plate which came with basically an open face gyro sandwich with rice and salad. Portions were ginormous and price was on point. Not expensive for what you get. I could of shared this plate with my husband and it would of been more than enough. Husband had the chicken souvlaki plate, which was 2 large chicken kabobs with rice, salad n pita. I tasted the chicken and it was moist and tasty. We also ordered the hummus. Everything tasted fresh not like some other Greek chains we've eaten at where the food tasted frozen and just heated up.  For 2 meals, 2 drinks and hummus w pita =total was around $35... we went home with tons of leftovers.  Yes will be ordering food from here in the future.

We are a fan now of this place especially when we are in the mood for a good Greek Salad. It was very good and one was enough to share. Uj0_SJ0FlfK31GjaqQYFJw.text: I love the food here. However, the growing popularity makes your service lack. You can see the bustle on the faces of both front line staff and cooks. A bit of suggestion to maintain the flow. If you know your kitchen is behind why not slow it down by just having one person ring in transactions on one register. The rest can do what they were doing which is one busing and the other running food. The guy at the register should not bounce back and forth between the two registers, you made the wait time horrendous. Especially since people who walked in 5 minutes behind me got their transaction and food before me. w5IHAPFszm-bONcVigfpsg.text: I wasn't overly happy to be dining here, as I'm a vegetarian, and most Greek places don't offer a lot, other than a Greek salad which I can make at home. Alas, my friend was set on coming to this place, and worst case scenario, I could go next door to Capriotti's.   That being said, I ended up ordering fries with feta and tzatziki sauce on top, and they were DELICIOUS!! However, not something I can order regularly unless I want to gain a hundred pounds lol. The tzatziki sauce was so incredibly good, I took a few bucks back up to the cashier to order another side of it, and she just gave me another side, free of charge. Staff was super friendly, and restroom and dining area were clean. This is close to my house and would really like to dine here again and try something different! Oh, he loved his gyro that he ordered, also.

I think i could eat this everyday, great Greek salad that came with the dish so I felt a little healthy! but all day long I'd go just for the gyro! Out of all the Greek places I've been to here this one has by far been the best. The cashier im sure was Greek and suggested the plate that I was already leaning towards, I've definitely gotta get more suggestions from her. I need to expand my Greek beyond gyro plates and kebobs, and I'm sure it will be there. It was a little busy at 2pm on a Sunday but im sure it's because the food is so good. I wasnt supposed to eat all the bread because I'm just diagnosed with diabetes but be dammed the bread was so good with the lamb I couldn't help it.

FbVE6sOBfmXAJzSTOUke-w.text: Ate here for the 2nd time today and boy was it still a disappointment. First time we came here, I ordered a falafel pita and was disappointed by what I got. Instead of getting light and fluffy on the inside, crunchy on the outside falafels, I got mushy falafels that were falling apart. I didn't think too much of it and attributed it to probably a bad batch. Came again today thinking it might be different, but what I got were still the same mushy, soggy, broken down falafels. They didn't even hold their shape when I got them! It would have been okay if it still had that crispy exterior, but even that was non-existent. To top it all off, we waited for my hubby's Greek salad with chicken for more than 15 minutes, while other people, who ordered the same thing after us, got theirs first. He finally went up to the lady to ask why it was taking so long, and lo and behold, his order was just sitting there on the counter. By the time we got his order, the chicken was no longer hot-- heck it wasn't even warm to say the least. We gave them a second chance, and were still sadly let down. Guess were sticking to Meraki's!

I didn't get a combo or a drink and I only got my sons kids meal. Ok, looking passed that, I've spent more on food, my son and I sat down. They were super busy since it was lunch time and figured I was going to wait, which I never mind waiting. Less than five minutes since I ordered our food came out. That was super fast for chicken gyro and a kids entree with rice m, but ok. The food was amazing, best chicken I've had in a while. Just disappointing how expensive it was for what I got, and then it came out so fast. Disappointing, but the chicken tasted amazing.

uuIRvKUlbXbQsX1bIkhj2Q.text: So first off, staff is super friendly and approachable. Got that little flirty smile but hey I feel the positive attitude haha   Monday 6pm-ish and dinner rush in full swing. Parking was a little competitive with other food options for dinner.   They offered complimentary water cup while waited because I ordered to go. I got two salad wraps one with chicken and one with shrimp. Both were pretty good and exactly what I expected to taste. The shrimp was a little more subtle so I think the chicken or red meats may be a better choice for balance.   Honestly i think the best way to go is the entree plate. It's plenty of food you have to get it with rice and feels like a proper full dinner meal from a clean flavored Mediterranean place. Whatever they advertise on the ingredients of each item you can expect to taste everything.   Wrap or salad is good if you want the lighter side of things.

7QX53G9KJw0aBxC0SypRVA.text: Walk in and order from the counter and put your order # on your table. In and outdoor seating. Outdoor area has festive Greek music piped in.  The lamb gyro special is a stewed meat mega filled gyro. Think osso-bucco like.  The lemon soup was chock full of chix confetti pieces in every spoonful. Yumso. Great for hangover.  The classic beef and lamb gyro as expected, lots of sauce and lots of meat. Not overly garlicky or salty.  Noticed no shredded greens in the gyros, but it had thin sliced tomatoes and red onion slivers.  Busy place with lots of take-out.

87EK-28tV3ST1_B7zo43eQ.text: This is pretty good Greek food! I don't think it's the best in town, but I enjoyed it. My friend Melissa loves it. It's her fave. We met another friend there for dinner. Neither of them had ever tried grape leaves before so I made them taste them. Pretty good! Could use a bit more tartness and they were certainly too cold. That made the rice kinda crunchy and weird. They should be a little chilled but not cold.   I had the gyro meat and steak combo platter with hummus. Yum!! The steak was delicious!! Cooked to order and tender. The gyro meat was also very tasty. They came on a bed of rice. The rice was nothing to write home about. Certainly not "Crack Rice" as we call Stefano's rice.   Our friend had the garlic fries and he raved about them. He even took them back to his hotel for later. Melissa had the kids meal because she loves their chicken and doesn't eat much. This is a nice place and the staff is great. Family friendly. Check it out!

uR7ICofyNW_3q7FXE3UZEA.text: Great bang for the buck. We order delivery from here several times a week. Nice portions and always tasty. Dont hesitate to try this place.

wCRE-LDDRMk-MNWXbub9Kg.text: The Great Greek is accurately named for their quality of fresh and healthy ingredients that are dished up in you favorite Greek dishes.   This past week, we wound up visiting this location due to a coworker suggestion. We were looking for a 'healthy' spot where we could all grab a fresh salad. We settled on this spot and were on our way.   After a short drive, my group of three arrived at this location for lunch. We were pleased to see they had adequate seating for us.   Although our visit was during their noon rush, we quickly placed our orders at their counter and our food was brought to our table in timely fashion.   I ordered a 'large' Greek Salad with Falafels that was served with a side of pita bread. The others in my group ordered a mixture of other large salads with either chicken or steak skewers. The portions for all of our lunches were exceptionally generous. We all thoroughly enjoyed our selections and felt everything we were served was super fresh and delicious.  I have visited their Henderson location, and prefer this spot on Blue Diamond due to having a more spacious interior and an updated patio with more seating.    We all enjoyed our time and plan to be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek Salad with Chicken skewer
Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek Salad with falafel

tMrE1GJxmpCAFvEc9ZNbwA.text: Loved this location! The service, the location, the atmosphere and the food are very deserving of 5 stars! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful! The restaurant itself was very clean and had such a cute interior with tables to sit at outside too! The food was delicious, I ordered a large greek salad with gyro meat and added extra gyro meat on the side with tzatziki sauce to go all over it! I will go back for sure; take out order in or delivery...i'll be doing it!!

uHzZ_DaLViwDSzIRFeVTLw.text: THE BEST GREEK FOOD this side of New York City!    - Hugh portions! - Good prices! - Friendly service! - Patio seating! - Great tasting food!  My only complaint - no Moussaka.   Give this place a try.  You will love it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Great Greek - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2D9vOyqE2F2OkHmz41fkKg.text: I love Great Greek! I fell in love with their rice bowls at their original Henderson location and it's my go-to order, usually with shrimp. The salad is so fresh and flavorful that it doesn't need the tzatziki sauce, which is delicious. Having the rice under the salad makes it especially filling but hard to reheat later. It remains one of my favorite Greek dishes in town though. Their Feta Fries and gyros are good too, but I tend to order their lighter options.  This location is larger and more welcoming than the other, with some outdoor seating. Service has been friendly and takeout orders are ready quickly. While I'm happy they're doing so well that they expanded to another location, I wish it were closer to me- the drive from Summerlin is just as far to go to either.   TIP: Portions are large, so plan ahead or purposely order extra to take home. The spanakopita travels well!

The atmosphere is fun and casual. They play all different styles of Greek music, which is cool to listen to. I just wish they had a location closer to us.

baLEHZmtkFnn6DJJkLfydA.text: This is one of my new favorite places in the SW. I've come here a few times already and the food is always fresh and delicious. I always get a steak and shrimp skewer plate with stuffed grape leaves. The restaurant is always clean and the staff is really nice. Highly Recommended!

UGguNTwaF2F-GdK65BEXcg.text: We were there last week for TISE. Found this place on the way back to LA, the place is very clean and bright. The service is excellent.  The food is really good and so is the quality. We will definitely go back again.

EZu7tqyCQMa0wivCi3d8SQ.text: This place has wonderful Greek food.  It's also so clean and the staff are always very sweet and helpful.  I've ordered almost everything on the menu and have used their catering menu too.

07dpX29RFMztoZxgwaWU3A.text: By far one of the best Greek restaurants in town.   The food! This location off blue diamond is always spot on with their gyro meat. Juicy, perfect spice blend, and generous in portions. I recommend the Gyro Plate with rice pilaf or Great Greek Gyro with feta fries if you're feeling indulgent! Haven't tried the baklava yet, but have heard amazing things about it.  Service has been top notch every time, with speedy serve times and plenty of staff to handle lines. It is an order at counter style eatery, so no table service. However, the effort that goes into the food and service deserves a gratuitous thank you. Treat them well and your tummies will thank you for a Great Greek time!

nO9Ij30vPrrpghihYiezKg.text: I love this place! They're always busy. I usually call ahead and order takeout. The food is always fresh and delicious. My go to place for a healthy meal when I'm too lazy or tired to cook.   Portion size is fair and reasonable. They always cook the steak skewers to the correct temperature. I've ordered chicken, shrimp and steak. They always cook the proteins perfectly, it's never dry at all.

kATn4HMnY-baFMpxaI_ZjA.text: Awesome, casual eatery in a modern and bright environment. The food is tasty but not at all greasy. Great portions and fast and friendly service. Definitely two thumbs up from me.

fVlhoUjWBYQSbu4RNTMiVA.text: Fantastic. So happy we stopped in for a late night dinner (9:30 pm) Delicious food at a reasonable price. We had gyro plates with rice pilaf and salad. All of this served in a casual counter to table atmosphere with clean modern ambience, real plates and silverware. The Greek really is Great and gets a full five stars from me. We will return.

0qJVsIlXKf90mLypypuAMw.text: My husband loves Greek food. I am so glad that he found a place he loves on our side of town. Now we can stay close to home and get his favorite food. I do have to say while Greek is not my favorite type of food, the quality and selection of food here was amazing!!

ppE7Q5uyIaBHu3hGfsJb2A.text: Love this place. Always clean, food is always great and service is awesome. Will def go back to this place again.

Ljkj4uDjJ1IDhLm8odF-3Q.text: This place was so cute! Walked in and was greeted very warmly by staff. It was pretty packed inside so I knew I was in for a treat! The guy at the counter was super friendly too and even gave us a couple suggestions since it was our first time there.   Like I said, they were pretty busy when we came in so I can understand waiting a little longer than usual but when I got my food, which I took to go, it was cold and the pita bread was a little hard.  Regardless, the food was still delicious and very flavorful. I ordered the chicken skewer which I highly recommend along with the feta fries! Yum!  Another disappointment was that they forgot to include the side of hummus in my order :(  I was super disappointed since I was really looking forward to trying it. Oh well !   The food was delicious but I really wish it wasn't cold when I ate it and I wish I got to try the hummus. I gave this place 3 stars but I want to give it another shot and maybe dine in next time! Will definitely update this review!!

c1HmH2cBoStigPMwiO5MZQ.text: My friend took me to lunch here for my birthday! I was craving Greek and had never been here before and she doesn't eat lamb, or onions, or... so this was a gamble on her part as well.  Absolutely terrific, delicious food.  When I ordered the gyros plate I was specific as to what I wanted and got exactly what I ordered and it was DELICIOUS.  Meat was well flavored and tender, the tzatziki was perfect and the pita was exactly the correct mix of soft/crispy that I like.  My friend discussed all her requirements while ordering at the counter and the gracious and helpful server made sure that absolutely everything was perfect before we were served at our table inside.  We were lucky enough to be against the window and watched a tiny boy and his father signing back and forth about his food demands...it would have gone viral if we'd filmed the 2-year old feeding himself the hummus.  So I think we were served immediately but can't be sure. lol.  I will not only go back but I've already been back.  And I ordered the hummus this time.  Great flavor.  Clean, great food, gracious and polite staff, efficient...it's my go to Greek forever.

nRUzAxItDU5B1Upa5KRjww.text: Seriously this place is the greatest! Food is always hot, fresh, totally tasty and practically melts in your mouth! Service is always good and everyone is friendly. If it is busy, it is always worth the wait. My favorite Greek place in town!

I couldn't think of any other place I'd rather try for catering my daughter's little 4th birthday staycation than The Great Greek. OMG it was AMAZING! If you have not tried this place please give it a shot. You will not be disappointed!!

7pDDNuQaYAKZrxpyezmA-w.text: Update-- 03/26/19:  Ordered here through the food delivery app Postmates. Postmates acts as a liaison for the restaurant, putting their menu up on the Postmates app, and then you order via Postmates to be connected to the restaurant who in turn makes the food how you put it into the Postmates app, and then Postmates delivers the food to your door.  So I used the app to order a traditional Gyro combo which I was prompted to select an optional drink & a complimentary included side or an upgraded side; both cost extra. I chose a Dr. Pepper for my drink, and I chose feta fries for my side. I also requested to have lettuce put on my Gyro. I also ordered grilled steak souvlaki plate cooked medium (because the Postmates app requires you choose a temp), with rice pilaf. And some soup and another A la cart feta fries. $37 for my meal after all of the up-selling Postmates does. Food is delivered to me after a long grueling day of packing & moving, I sit down with my family, open my meal, ask my partner where my Dr Pepper is, and I have regular fries, no Dr. Pepper, and no lettuce like requested. My partner began eating his meal and the steak he requested medium was about well done as a leather shoes. NOT EDIBLE! I am scratching my head wondering if I chose everything that I thought I did. I go back and look at my receipt from Postmates and it does show that I ordered a gyro combo but doesn't mention anything about the drink or feta fries. I know I was prompted to select these items, and so I go back and toy with the app and it confirmed what I already knew, it did prompt me to select all of the add-ons I wanted, but yet somehow Postmates delivered it to the restaurant with no modifications. I called the restaurant right away and explained my frustrations, and the woman who I assume was part of management says "well this isn't our fault, call Postmates, I put in the bag what the computer tells me", couldn't care less that there is obviously some glitch within the Postmates system, that isn't relaying the orders back to their business properly; and pretty much acknowledged there's a problem but she was sorry and contact Postmates for a refund if I was unhappy. Seriously how dense can you be? I'm trying to help you out, even though I got the short of the stick and had my night ruined with a bad meal. And yet I take the time to contact you to let you know there's a problem affecting the livelihood of your business and you shoo me off and tell me to go complain to the courier service instead for a refund? Gotcha, I guess no good deed goes unpunished and that was more than blatantly obvious by the arrogance of the employee on the phone. Also no accountability for the poor quality food we received as well, which really irks me. How hard is it to cook steak medium?! When this place is good they are really good, and when they are bad they are just absolutely awful. Whatever, lose more customers because Postmates can't apparently get it right.  Last few times I've been here I was not impressed. Nothing is more frustrating than when you go into a place that's fast casual and it takes them 20-30 minutes to make your food. That has been the case tonight and two weeks ago when I was in. No apologies from the staff either, which is even more irritating. But the thing that really gets me, they ask if you need togo utensils & yet they never put them in the bag. I'm on the go and how the hell am I suppose to eat my soup or pastichio with no spoon or fork? I know that sounds petty, but it's a huge problem when you're on the go. They need to figure out a way to expedite the food faster, sometimes it seems like disorganized chaos.

S8lcIaiqKlaPNt5xNrc2LA.text: Love this place!!! Food is good with big portions. Staff is very nice and attentive. I ordered the gyro and shrimp plate absolutely delicious. Would recomend this place. Today was my 2nd visit and we will definitely be going back!!

jiTPp4c11qGJ4MVclceeGA.text: We love this place and nearly order weekly. I love the greek salad! My husband loves the Athenian burger and the steak skewers. The feta fries are also not to be missed. The service is consistent and wonderful, and I really appreciate how they always ask if we need plastic wear or not (we always decline). Most places load you up with single use plastic as I have a cabinet full at the moment.

mnyVmq7Y46Jv5ba4pyWL0g.text: Service was good, the staff was very friendly and recommended some dishes. The food was average to above-average, the tables were a little dirty but not too bad. Pretty good for a quick sit down meal, nothing fancy.

Z6STs2TqEJpIM79A6hJoyQ.text: Stopped in for lunch... it has a nice, fresh look to it.  I ordered the mezze plate, my husband got the greek salad with a steak skewer.  The mezze plate was good. The spanakopita was huge. The grape leaves had a great taste along with the tzaziki. The hummus was ok. I wish they had falafel on the plate too.    My husband said his salad and steak skewer were good. The salad (small) was huge. He could not finish it. This is a great spot for a fresh meal on a road of fast food.

pgj9j39vKPCCSF-CBiB9RA.text: Shrimp are amazing. Fat and juicy. Loved the whole meal. Fat gyros and the kids meal came with fries and salad. Great prices; Amazing prices for Vegas. Quality food. Would eat again if I weren't leaving in the AM. Viva Las Vegas, baby!

8S41gABEvnZXsF09oVzsOA.text: Wow! I was delighted to have sampled the delectable Mediterranean cuisines at The Great Greek. I savored the steak entree and my hubby had the gyro one. Each dish starts off with salad and the fries were so so tasty. I have to say, the hummus here is one of the best I've had. The service was very attentive and the whole restaurant well kept. The portions were very generous and the value for what is served is quite plentiful. If you're craving appetizing Mediterranean fare at a great price, you'll love The Great Greek!

EXU36egSBKKQtIsJ6UvxVA.text: Stopped here soon after they opened, new carry out packed but was driving so was fine with getting a gyro and baklava to go. It was normal but expensive. NEVER EVER AGAIN. 2 gyros and 2 baklava were over 28.00 and i took 2 bites of the gyro and got sick. This clearly was not the lamb i ordered. See the pics, they clearly are cutting costs and selling shredded beef for lamb. Baklava didnt drip honey even once. Philo so dry. NEVER EVER AGAIN.

Much faster than a sit-down casual format.   I ordered the Great Greek Gyro and made it a combo, adding a drink and rice pilaf. My gyro was filled to the brim with meat and was happily stuffed at the end of my meal. Since it's so close to home, this will be my go-to Greek restaurant going forward.

OSiCsSAobZaCRxrYEczfOg.text: Great food for people who love vegetarian food and people who love meat. Perfect location for any preferences!

Sw-6jkLa7fDDXVqbdZkRTQ.text: I was dying to try this location and just like their Warm Springs location this restaurant did not disappoint. The freshness and flavors and service are EXACTLY the same as their other location. Quite impressive!  I have to add the consistency clearly states how well run this business is. My favorite meal is the Original Greek Rice Bowl. The flavors just work so perfectly together. I order it twice a week!.....it's a huge salad consisting of perfectly seasoned rice on the bottom topped with the freshest, flavorful greek salad you'll ever taste. I always get a chicken skewer on top and the chicken is consistently cooked to perfection. Their tzatziki sauce is outstanding too. The food here is always so fresh and flavorful I just keep coming back.   My only complaint is I wish they'd open a restaurant around the Anthem/Eastern Ave area. PLEASE!!!!

It's a great location and has a cool interior and patio seating. The fries are absolutely to die for. Love having this fresh and healthy and delicious option nearby me.

NSYjiBIYWYmZwcgLl1Dfcg.text: First off.    I really like the concept of the great greek food.    I order the chicken bowl on a regular basis (at least once a month), unfortunately the past 3 times I have been the chicken has been so dry that it is almost inedible.   As a takeout there is really no recourse but it is an indication that something is wrong in their process.    Hopefully they can look into this and correct it, until then I'm not going to return.   Everything else is spot on, the rice, lettuce, everything.    Please fix the problem with your meat and we will return

vWGT2aEQ7TA6ntSedYHfDg.text: Probably the most amazing quick Greek place in Las Vegas. I eat here at least two to three times a week.

K-pvkfe59aC6uhWmtX8sQQ.text: The best Mediterranean foods and very reasonable price. Vegetables are fresh cut and crunchy. Their very generous of meat servings. Friendly staff. Become one of my favorite here in Vegas.

LvLkiE4nm6I1qpLzJZhA8w.text: This is my favorite Greek place in town, it's just a bit pricey I feel. The food is really good and quality is as well. However, three meals and drinks, with tip was $60. That's why they get four instead of five stars. I'd be here all the time if it were less expensive.   I've never had anything bad or disappointing here, and the kids like it. Even the picky one likes it because it's simple. We usually get chicken or steak souvlaki when we are there, and it's offered with fries or rice pilaf not also comes with a really good side Greek salad. The kids plates aren't quiet half price and come with one skewer instead of two. I order the full size and they split it.   Yesterday they were offering a special of mousakka (sp) and it was really good. It's egg plant, ground beef, potatoes and bechamel sauce  it also came with the side salad.   I recommend the feta fries, falafels, hummus with pita, cookies and baklava as well. We don't always get those but they never disappoint.   I like that they have healthy options that are just part of the regular menu, because you really can't go wrong with a protein and salad.

CMJKrzo0V7QFKLkk5Bw8XQ.text: Let's just say I could be in trouble as this place is basically right across the street from my house.  So I might be spending a lot more time there soon.    Went there for the first time today for lunch.  I had the chicken souvlaki plate which came with either french fries or rice, Greek salad, Tzatziki sauce and pita bread.  I choose the french fries for my plate.  I love it that I have choices on what sides I want on my plate.    It came with 2 skewers of chicken with like 6 pieces on each. The chicken tasted great and was cooked prefect.  The side Greek salad was real fresh with plenty of veggies and tasted real good.  The french fries were cooked prefect crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside.  The Tzatziki sauce was fantastic almost as good as my mom's.  The pita bread came out nice and warm and tasted good too.  I asked for extra onions on my salad and on the side which they gladly gave me no extra charge.  The plate cost $12.95 so price was not too expensive for all the food you get.  There was plenty of condiments, napkins and etc on the counter and on the tables. It was enough food to keep me full all day.  The guy that took my order was real nice and answered all my questions.  The food came out pretty quickly and looked nice.  The place was real clean plenty of different seating areas.  I will be back for sure as a matter of fact thinking about going there for lunch tomorrow already.

YUd0knIiyUFTnnEpOmxh3g.text: Authentic Greek food that tastes amazing! We have yet to dine in here but do call in for takeout. Have not had a bad thing yet. You just have to ask them to bag your salad separate. Love that there is a good Greek place on the south west side of town now.

The half salad is a large portion, so if your a light eater it's perfect as salad doesn't keep well for leftovers. Grab a small baklava or butter cookie for after your meal. Dont wait, they sell out quickly.

The usual is the great gyro and a steak plate and a small side of hummus....and the FETA FRIES!! Those are a must try. You can also do a mixed plate... I do steak and shrimp sometimes. Only reason they didn't get 5 stars is they messed up on my to-go order, nothing big just forgot my small side of hummus but was refunded for it.  Put it this way, I don't review anything but I just want people to know how great this place is!

Then they opened the Blue Diamond location and I have to say it's not a good representation of this company at all. The food is still good but the service.. Jesus! The girls in the front are either overworked to the point where they don't remember to smile OR they really don't smile! There's one that I try to avoid at all cost when I go. I am a regular customer and by "regular", I mean I purchase food from here 3 times a week at least. However, I will NOT go when that girl is there. I heard her tell the kitchen staff "If you have something to say, you can work somewhere else" while I was eating today. I was shocked and that was the last straw. I will not eat at this location anymore. If I ever want their food I'll make the 15 mile trip to Henderson just to avoid this chick..

Only next time I will order tziki on the side, as it wasn't evenly distributed, but who cares cause the food was great.  Growing up in NYC and lots of gyros, I was very happy when hubby brought it home. Since first posting, we have been there over 12 times.  Three of those times we brought other guests, a few of them from out of town.  I just recommended them  Saturday night to a friend who lives in the neighborhood who didn't even know it existed.  They went yesterday (Sunday) for lunch and loved it.  I think they have a new customer who will be back. Reminds me of a greek fast food place back in my home town of Bayside, NY.
